campaign.story:
Centuries before the first universities, the internet and the modern era of scientific discovery there was the Great Library of Alexandria.
Created to store the world's knowledge, its scribes would copy every book found on every ship that entered Alexandria, and would go on to accumulate untold volumes of history, mathematics, geography, politics and more.
Unfortunately, it was not to last. It was destroyed during the many conquests of Alexandria, and all that knowledge was lost forever.
We may never really know how it happened, but the compelling story of its destruction has inspired us to publish this unconventional game. Join us in retelling the story of the burning of the Great Library!
The game as presented here is exactly what we imagined a great eurogame to be. It contains 138 unique illustrations by Vincent Dutrait and Asterman Studio, which aim to evoke a feeling of exploration and adventure.
Alexandria is complete and includes the highest quality card & cardboard material, as with all our games - 2mm thick cardboard, linen finish, 320gr-weight cardstock, the works.
However, we also have a "dream" version of the game, with custom-shaped wooden tokens that enhance the playing experience. For that we will order a limited amount of custom-shaped wooden token sets:
These tokens are meant to replace the cardboard tiles and give a more tactile playing experience. Just like our previous "big" game, CRISIS, availability of this edition may be limited.
  Designed by Babis Giannios (KUNE v LAKIA, Shadows over the Empire), Alexandria is a eurogame that takes 45-60 minutes to play, albeit a more unconventional one. With asymmetrical gameplay and a shrinking gameplay area, parts of the library are slowly consumed by fire as Heroes seek the treasures within it.
Each of the four Heroes in the game has a different reason for being in the library at the time, and each one has different skills and motivations.
As they move through the randomly-generated layout of the library, the Heroes interact with what they find in the rooms, as well as with each other.
They position themselves to take advantage of the situation as it unfolds, and must manage their time wisely.
In so doing they may rescue books, items or persons and be rewarded with fame. Throughout the game they are confronted by their shared destiny, and this will lead to the dramatic end that defines the ultimate fate of the library.
For more details on the components and rules of Alexandria, download the rule book here (5 MB, right click and Save as…).
Please download this file, as PDFs viewed in-browser may not display properly. This file is the low-resolution version of the rules document.
If you find any mistakes, please use this form to submit them: https://goo.gl/forms/jTFX4bDRvO7cuejD2
As usual, we offer you the chance to try the game before you back the campaign. The game has been implemented on Tabletopia, and you can play for free here:
  Keep in mind that prototype components and some placeholder art is shown below. For example, the Hero boards will be cut to a custom shape around the illustration. Please refer to the contents graphic for up to date images.
          We expect to fulfill all rewards from within the EU, and as a result EU backers do not have to worry about customs or VAT.
We are not able to offer multiple-game pledge levels through the campaign because we need to have a clear picture of how many copies to make - which will be just a few more than we need for the campaign. Since we already subsidize the shipping costs, a bulk pledge would not even save any money.
However, we do expect to have a post-campaign pledge manager via Backerkit, which allows us to manage stock levels.
Shipments to backers outside of the EU will have 35 EUR declared as the value of the package. That's roughly equivalent to 41 USD / 52 CAD / 52 AUD / 40 CHF / 4548 JPY / 46740 KRW. Note that we can not be responsible for any customs fees.
Tracking is not offered through this campaign. If tracking is important to you, please contact us via the KS messaging system before the campaign is over. Please note that we can not take any responsibility for any lost or damaged copies to Brazil, Hungary, Russia, or South Africa.
Even though we will be exhibiting at Spiel, and we hope to have Alexandria there, we are not able to offer pickup in Essen. There are many reasons for that, including the risk that it will not be produced in time, the limited space and time needed to hold and hand out copies to backers whose identity we need to confirm, backers not picking up their game, and more. If you would like to get your game there, it is better to not back the campaign (or back for $1 to follow it), and buy it on site. However, we can not guarantee we will have enough copies for everyone. We expect that the price will be 40-50+ EUR, depending on the edition, and on whether we have any Deluxe copies for sale.
  What You See Is What You Get - this is our doctrine, and we like to run simple, straightforward campaigns. We are aware that add-ons and/or stretch goals would increase the funding total. However, we have already thrown everything into this game - a lot of time, effort, and money.
We also want to offer the game at the cheapest cost possible - and that is incompatible with stretch goals. We'd have to add "hidden" profit in the pledge levels that we can then "spend" to give you stretch goals - nothing is for "free". Therefore, raising money beyond our goal does not give us extra money on hand to create stretch goals.
Furthermore, because the games are made in Europe in a small print run, we do not benefit from economies of scale by producing a few more copies of the game.
We do not offer add-ons (not even our other games) during the campaign, because we want to keep our operations simple and deliver efficiently. We may however be able to offer a post-campaign chance to obtain other games, if stock levels and our operations allow. We are in this for the long run, so it does not help us to squeeze a few more dollars from a few backers, if we would disappoint *all* backers. We have a reputation for shipping on time or early, and this is how we minimize the risk of missing our deadlines.
Finally, we do not pay anyone to give an opinion on our games.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our previously launched campaigns in 2017 are still in progress and on schedule. Long Live The Queen and IUNU are in production. Diesel Demolition Derby is now in the campaign phase, but print prep has already started, and is expected to be on schedule. This project is independent of any other. We are working with a manufacturer we have worked with before, and we are confident in our ability to deliver the game and any additional materials. That said, unforeseen events may affect how quickly fulfillment is conducted, and the graphics and components seen here are subject to change (however improbable). We will be exhibiting at Essen, and it is possible that some backers or other people may have the game in hand before you do, although we plan to ship your games first. Note that our goal is to ship the game on time, by the dates listed on the pledge levels. Shipping a package is different than delivering a package. We do not deliver your game; the shipping company does. Therefore, delivery times will vary according to your local postal service. Once we ship, the shipment is the responsibility of the shipping company. If tracking is important to you, please let us know before pledging. If your reward does not arrive, it is returned to us, so we need you to patiently wait until that happens. Many times we have re-sent a reward only for the backer to receive both the original and the replacement. Informal currency conversions made on this campaign may not be accurate by the time you read this and may therefore result in seemingly cheaper prices in the future. Please do not play with fire, especially near any invaluable ancient papyri (or was it papyruses?) you may be responsible for. Always check the structural integrity of a room before you enter it. Read books. Eat Nutella. Play more games. By backing this project, you indicate that you have read, understood, and agreed with the above. If you have any questions, please contact us directly via the KS messaging system.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings, LudiCrats!
(apologies in advance if you are backer of our other 2017 campaigns and receive this message multiple times - we are shipping everything at the same time)
... and so does Babis:

Greetings, LudiCrats!
(apologies in advance if you are backer of our other 2017 campaigns and receive this message multiple times - we are locking all surveys down at the same time)

Greetings, LudiCrats!
We are now neck-deep in the production process, and we are aiming to complete the games as promptly as possible. We are on track for fulfillment as scheduled.

Greetings, LudiCrats!
Wow, that is quite the finish! Together with a nice round 1400 of you, we are now able to create a truly unique game.

Greetings, LudiCrats!
Many thanks for your support in the beginning of this campaign! Also, we extend a special thanks to those who helped us in proofreading the rulebook!

There can be many ways to say thank you, but we can only choose the one that simply conveys our feelings right now. On behalf of Babis and the whole development team, we want to say "thank you", a simple, unadulterated, genuine expression of our gratitude to you.

campaign.story:
Airways Airlines needs your help. New passengers are flooding in. It's up to you to get them to their destinations before they get too angry and complain. If we get too many complaints, we'll be shut down.
Now Boarding is a cooperative boardgame for 2-5 Players which plays in 30-60 minutes.  Each player has their own airplane they will be using to pickup and deliver passengers. Every round, more passengers show up. Players will need to plan together to make sure everyone gets picked up and taken to their destination on time.
Things get crazy when the timer starts. Players have 30 seconds to take their turns – AT THE SAME TIME. Not only that, but new passengers show up right as the timer starts, throwing a wrench in your plans.
Each player has their own unique route only they can take. You'll need to use these routes frequently to save precious travel time. But doing so requires tricky passenger handoffs and coordination between players.
As players deliver passengers, they earn money that is used to upgrade their planes - allowing you to fly faster and carry more passengers.
A intense, cooperative, pick-up-and-deliver game
Make complex, logistical decisions - in a matter of seconds
Experience the mayhem of running your own airline
Mounting tension as more and more passengers arrive
All new art from acclaimed illustrator, Ryan Goldsberry
2-5 player, ages 10+, 30-60 minutes
        Read the rules here  
Grab the Print and Play files here
   Click the images to read reviews
                                "Now Boarding is the kind of cooperative game that hits that great balance where every player contributes and everyone has to carry their own weight. It’s really unique, unlike any other game, cooperative, or real-time, or anything I’ve played before, and I do recommend you check it out." - Meeple Overboard
"Interesting decisions, lively table talk, and a really good time ... there was mounting tension, there was laughter, there was success - the hallmarks of any great co-op ... I will be backing this on Kickstarter the minute it goes live." - @gamegeekninja
 "It's hectic and crazy, and just about makes you feel some sympathy for the airlines when they leave you stranded without a seat. Almost. An intense blend of logistics and real-time action." - Jonathan H. Liu, GeekDad Full review here
"Now Boarding walks a tightrope between smart strategy and manic energy. You'll work together to form your plan, only to watch as it all goes awry and your group scrambles to make it all work. Table talk is everything, making Now Boarding a great social experience, and the game's a good time too!" - Gameosity
"Now Boarding takes real time cooperative games to a new level. The puzzle every player is attempting to solve together keeps you engaged and thinking the whole game. There is a ton of strategic bang without overly complex rules or a long play time. This is a must have for any gamer that likes cooperative play or real time." - Sam Aho, Sam Says
"Now Boarding is a solid game with a good hook that gets players involved quickly. The game play is very straightforward, but never the path to victory. Players must work together and talk things out constantly or the game will crumble. Unlike other cooperative games, players cannot be taking their moves in a vacuum and must depend on others to do things in certain sequences if they are to be successful."
Father Geek
          Announcing a new add-on!
We have partnered with the developers at Dino Polo Club to bring you Mini Metro!  Mini Metro is a minimalist subway simulation game about designing efficient subway networks. The player must constantly redesign their line layout to meet the needs of a rapidly-growing city. It really feels like a lot like Now Boarding, with the crunchy routing puzzles to solve, and passengers losing patience :-)  Only $5 for a copy via Steam for PC.(normally $9.99) Grab the new pledge tier, or grab it later in the pledge manager.
  Wok Star was my first boardgame and I'm bringing it back for the fans. This will be a new 3rd edition of the game. Like Now Boarding, Wok Star is a realtime cooperative game for 1-4 players. Players are members of the Wang family, trying to keep their Chinese restaurant in business. Each player has a unique responsibility - ingredients to prepare, and recipes to serve.  And you only have 20 seconds to serve each customer.
I'm mixing the best elements from the first two editions, and adding some new, modern mechanics. I want to keep it's identity as a game, but tweak a few things to keep it dynamic. There will be more paths to victory via new investments, each with their own risks and rewards. There are more ways to use your dice and deal with bad rolls. And of course it’ll keep the great art and fun sense of humor.  
Coordinate "Grocery Runs" that allow all players to reroll use their dice again.  
Go fancy and add new ingredients to your dishes allowing you to make more money.
Earn "Hustle" which allows you to manipulate dice in a pinch. 
It will come in the same size box as Now Boarding, 6”x9”x1.5” It'll have sandtimers and a timer app. Check out the new tiers that include copies of Wok Star.
  Tim here  - Now Boarding started 10 years ago as a videogame (nowboarding.us).  My friend Tom Mason and I wanted to be indie game developers. We came up with a quirky time management game that captured the craziness of running an airline.  It's been a crazy journey since then  - working at game studios and recently going full time making boardgames.  So now it's back, converted into a boardgame that still has the interesting routing problems, angry passengers, time pressure - but now you have your friends to help!
Help guide the development of this game. We listen to our backers and strive to implement their clever ideas. 
Once funded, our stretch goals will add more content and better components to improve the game for everyone.
Backers receive the game at a discount compared to after the campaign. This game is not going to distributors.
It may not be in your local store.
Without your help, we won't be able to print this game and share it with the world.
European copies will be sent from inside the EU to avoid VAT.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I will be working with my established partners for printing, shipping and fulfillment. I've worked with them during my previous Kickstarter campaigns for Paperback, Burgle Bros, Fugitive, and Hardback. If there are any manufacturing issues I will address them. If anyone has trouble receiving their copy or has problems with parts in their copy, contact me for a replacement.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hey Everyone, Tim here. Long ago, I made a videogame called Now Boarding.  While I do mostly make boardgames these days, I do occasionally make a videogame.  A new game I made is now available!  It's called Pegleg.  It's mix of pinball and tower defense -  with Pirates.  It's for PC and Mac and available here.  We are crowdfunding sales of this alpha version to fund expanding and adding more levels, powers and enemies to the game.  Check it out here

updates.update_userinfo: Game of the Year! Pins now available!
updates.update_content:
Hey Now Boarding passengers, 
The game you helped create has been name Game of the Year 2018 by the channel No Pun Included!  I'm honored and so glad people are enjoying the game.

Hey everyone, Tim here.  Now Boarding was well received at Gen Con!  We ran games of it at our booth and people had a blast with it.  Lots of backers also came by to say hi.  
So the latest game I've been working on is something different.  It's a 2 vs 2 stealth game of hunting and hiding.  It's called Sabotage:

updates.update_userinfo: Now Boarding and Wok Star now available for Retailers
updates.update_content:
This is your Captain speaking, we are in our final approach and we ask that all backer please put their seatback in the full upright position and update their final shipping address here: Survey Request Link
The shipments have started arriving, but the US shipment has been held for extra inspection :(  Should just add a few days onto the process.  Hope to be shipping in ~10 days.

Captain checking in here, we have an update on the shipping situation.  The games are on the boats and headed to the warehouses!  Below are the Vessel names you can track 
US
EVER LIBRA
UK
CMA CGM GEORG FORSTER

Hey Now Boardees, 
Not much news - the manufacturer just returned from Chinese New Year and they are working on both Now Boarding and Wok Star.  The latest dates for them completing manufacturing are March 15 for Now Boarding and March 28 for Wok Star.  So if sea freight and customs go smoothly we should be shipping to you guys at late April.

We just receive the manufacturer sample of Wok Star - and it's looking good!  We had them tweak a couple things(like they only had one timer) but overall it was well done and we're giving the ok to manufacture the rest!
To anyone curious about the rules and changes - give them a read here

Hey Passengers,
Merry Christmas!  Hope you all had safe travels to your holiday destinations.  We're grateful for all of your support to help make these games happen.
Now Boarding: We are waiting on the sample from the manufacturer.  Once it looks good, we'll start production.  If you want to browse the rules, .  You can see a lot of the final art there as well.  We will have one more shot to make any last rules edits if you find anything.

campaign.story:
Every spring, the cherry trees blossom all over Japan. The Japanese celebrate this occasion, as according to their traditions, the goddess of Fuji mountain, Konohana Sakuya Hima revives the fallen flowers at this time. The cherry flower is a symbol of vitality, it is called Sakura.
The players in this game aim to play cards without taking any tricks. They have to play two cards each time, one on each side of the Jin-Jang card following the rules. The players are aided in their success by several characters, who require payment (coins). The best tactician will earn the least points by managing their coins the best and will win the favor of the goddess and glory will be theirs till next spring.
For 2-6 players aged 10 and above.
 Easy to learn
The game is easy to learn and to teach. The active player has to play a card from hand onto each face-up card on the table.
The placed card must be the same colour as the card on the top of the pile, and it must be either greater or lesser in value then the top card, depending on the direction of the Yin- Yang card. Cards with the values of 1 and 13 count as adjacent. On the increasing side, a 1 may follow a 13, on the decreasing side a 13 may follow a 1.
OR  
The placed card is the same value as the top card on the deck but is of a different colour.
Example:
Tactical depth 
If you cannot play a card using the main rules, you may hire one or more characters. To win the game you have to manage your coins well and combine the available character skills. 
Example: The player in his last turn cannot play any card by default. He has 5 coins, so he can use the first Samurai for 2 coins. It reverses the Yin-yang card and now he can play a black number 3 onto the right side. Now he pays his remaining 3 coins on Konohana, which allows him to play a card in any color. That way he can play his number seven card on the left side.
You have to take the pile(s) where you cannot play new card(s) in your turn. You will get coins from the cards immediatelly, but unfortunately they contain penalty points too, and only the player with the fewest points can be the winner of Sakura.
             Note: Some components will not be included in the retail version and will be buyable only separately.
  The game components are language independent, the rulebook will be included in 4 languages: English, French, German and Hungarian. 
The latest rules are available on our homepage: http://a-games.hu/en/download/ 
Direct link: English rules, Hungarian rules, German rules, French rules
Additional: Spanish rules, Italian rules
Note: The rulebooks are subject to change in the final product. The German and French rules are under translation.
How to add games to your pledge? If you have a pledge already, press the "Manage Your Pledge" Button, otherwise you will have to choose one of the pledge levels first. Increase your pledge in the 'Pledge Amount' box by the total price of the add-ons you want to add. No additional shipping cost required. Overall up to 10 games allowed per pledge. After the campaign in the survey you will be able to confirm the details of your pledge.
   Shipping is a great challenge as always. The product should arrive on time, in mint condition and without exorbitant shipping costs. We decided to use Happyshops for their fulfillment services. The shipping cost will be added automatically to your pledge amount based on your location. Our campaign is EU and US friendly, it is guaranteed that you will not be charged with any additional fees on your pledge amount. We are shipping from within these regions. For other regions in some cases you may expect additional customs charges depending on your local regulations, but we and our experienced fulfillment partners will make sure to keep these fees as low as possible. We set the estimated delivery to October-November 2017 depending on your location.  
FREE Essen pickup (26th - 29th of October, 2017): As in previous years, we will have a booth (Hall 7, G101) again this year during the Essen Spiel. We invite you to come to our booth and pick up your games personally. For the Essen pickups the ordered game quantity is unlimited. Please use the separate Essen pickup pledge levels, if you would like to get your copy in Essen.
The summarized shipping prices: 
Due to an error please use the Essen pickup level, if you are from SWITZERLAND, and add 4EUR to your pledge manually. 
Maximum 10 games allowed per order. In order to offer the best possible deal, there is also a chance to add more games to you pledge. Buy more and lower your cost per game! For your pledge you get your second and further copies or add-ons with no additional shipping cost.
Retailers
Retailers will get the games the same time as any other backers , before the official release. If you're a retailer, please contact us at info@a-games.hu during the campaign for a private conversation.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are familiar with that producing a game is a great challenge with many tasks. This will be our 5th released game overall and we already had crowdfunding project on Kickstarter also. Ave Roma, our 1th Kickstarter project met the target in a bit over a day and closed on almost 400% funding. All extra copies of Ave Roma sold out in one day at Essen 2016 and we already had second printing due to the huge demand. A few lessons were learned from that campaign, we are sure we have an even better process for the packaging and delivery of our games worldwide.

During the campaign all the graphics, rules and minor fixes will be finalized and applied to Sakura. Our new main manufacturing partner is located in Poland and they have plenty of experience with several large publishers already. We are certain that we will have high quality components produced as the second print of Ave Roma was already made by them. Almost instantly after the campaign ends, the game will be in production. The fullfillment will be done now through Happyshops worldwide. For the freight shipping we will use our usual partner Kuehne + Nagel.

We want to keep you updated with all the relevant information about the progress of the project. We are confident to give you the best possible product and support. :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
Our Impression campaign is getting closer to its ending. Maybe some of you already saw the campaign page or even read the rules or tried it on Tabletopia. But, if you didn’t, there is still some time to check it out. During the past days we added 6 further videos, which are intended to help understand the game better. Also there is a solo playthrough which is a full-length solo game played by Attila. Feel free to check out these, so you can have a better understanding about our game idea. We hope you find them useful and you will join us in our campaign.

Dear backers,
It’s been a while since our last Kickstarter project. Now, we are getting closer to a new campaign. Our newest complex board game project called Impression is coming to Kickstarter on 15th of September. Until that we would like to post more info about it from time to time (on Facebook, BGG, A-games site). Now, in short, what you can expect:

Dear backers,
Our 2 week long campaign for our next release called Wombattle is started now. 
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1205265935/wombattle
This time it is a new category for us, it is a party board game. We believe many of you will like this game too. Wombattle will contain some unique elements as you got used to from us: a fun way of category selection and real awards. A fast phased, easy to learn board game coming this time. Please check out our campaign when it is started and of course we are glad, if you join.

Our new Kickstarter campaign just launched. Check out Attila Szőgyi's new design and back us if you like what you see!  
Prehistory link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1205265935/prehistory
Kind regards,
A-games team

Dear backers,  
As you know, we had some troubles with the fulfillment lately, so we would like to follow up and share some news. Most of the packages arrived to our backers, but some of you still not received theirs. Unfortunately, we had some issues with Happyshops in the past months, and they don’t use tracking for many packages, which means slower delivery and causing troubles when we need to track an issue or find solution.
Solution: new process

Dear backers,
If you followed the comment section in the past weeks, you saw we had issues with Happyshops about the deliveries. We would like to summarize the status, so it will be easier you to follow up.  
Summary

Dear backers,  
We are sure, you are excited to have your games in your hand. Like us. We can assure you we feel the same. This great journey is coming near to its end where all of you can play our new release, Sakura.  
Shipping status

Dear backers,
We received those retail copies that will be available in Essen and the KS versions will be delivered directly to the fair on Wednesday. The other shipments are being organized and the fulfillment can start in time in November. 
Here are some pictures about the final product of Sakura:

updates.update_userinfo: Essen pickup Hall7 G101, production update
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
We have to do a short update to make sure you will receive the information. 
Lately you received or you will receive an automatized invoice, but don't panic. This is just a formal administrative task from our side (Akabón Kft, A-games) what has to be done. No action required, as your payment is already done. Also you will receive a second sometime, but still it is just a formal invoice. This is the law in our country, so it has to be done and it can be ignored.

comments.content: Preposterous.

You had done nothing wrong, but I am showing you the reason why many backers aren't exactly happy with the campaign. campaign.story:
Welcome to the final Heroes Wanted Card Game Kickstarter! If you're not familiar with Heroes Wanted, check out the game and its website! The heroes in Zeta City began fighting three years ago, and now we're back on Kickstarter to go out with a bang!
Earth! Air! Fire! Water! Danger? Zeta City has seen its share of heroes, but none the likes of these. Elemental heroes join the fray, harnessing the very forces of nature against an all new bevy of criminal geniuses, sentient websites, and opinionated baddies!
But wait! There's more! Not only does this expansion for Heroes Wanted add a brand new hero type to your already near-infinite game play options, it also provides even more content for the other hero types in the game. Players will now have bonus cards unique to their hero, as well as never-before-seen epic actions! And the fun doesn't stop there! Elements of Danger also introduces improved basic actions to make your hero even more unique!
Be a hero. Save the day. Make the team!
  Heroes Wanted Elements of Danger is a special release, not only is it the last in the Heroes Wanted line of games, it is not likely to go into distribution.  This kickstarter project and limited number of games at Essen & BGG CON (if we make it in time) will be the only way to get the expansion in 2017.  In 2018, we will be selling this expansion directly via conventions and Amazon only - it will not be entering normal distribution channels.  If there are any copies left, we may be selling those into distribution in 2019 or later - but there is no guarantee that we will do so.
Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger is a superhero adventure game for 1-5 players that plays in 45 minutes. For more information, we encourage you to view the videos directly below, or simply read our draft rulebook here.
Click HERE to watch Rahdo Runs Through Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger Gameplay.
Rahdo Runs Through Heroes Wanted
The Dice Tower Reviews - Heroes Wanted
Bearded Meeple reviews Heroes Wanted
     Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger is the final expansion to the Heroes Wanted line of games, and what an expansion it will be! The ultimate Champion pledge will contain the newest expansion plus:
Heroes Wanted - The base game includes over 200 cards, four scenario boards, and tons of tokens. 
Extra, Extra - Fifty-four more heroes, villains, and quirks. 
Champions & Masterminds - Mini-expansion that allows you to play Heroes Wanted as a full co-op. 
The Stuff of Legend - The first big box expansion that includes 110 cards, two new hero types, new villains, new quirks, and two new scenario boards. 
Breaking News - Fifty-four more heroes, villains, and quirks. 
Champions & Masterminds 2 - Mini-expansion that adds new Champions to play as and Masterminds to battle.
In total, over 10,000 different hero combinations and over 400 different villain combinations equals near endless replayability!
                 We'll be making frequent updates during this project to let you know about all the great stretch goals we have planned for you!
Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger is the 39th project from the combined teams behind Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games. With the successful execution of our first 38 projects, we have become experienced publishers with a reputation for great games (in design and production) that are delivered in a timely fashion. 
Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger was designed by Nick Little and Travis R. Chance. This game has undergone extensive testing and development to ensure the best possible experience. We are confident that this game will be in your collection for years to come. 
Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger is not going into distribution. This may be your only opportunity to buy it.
All of the art assets are complete and ready for immediate upload after the project funds. 
Prices include US shipping. This project is also EU and Canadian friendly.
Kickstarter is the world's largest funding platform for creative projects. Every month, tens of thousands of people pledge millions of dollars to creative projects in dozens of categories. 
A person who supports a project is called a "backer." The process of giving money to this project is called a "pledge." 
In return for your pledge, we (the creators of the campaign) are able to offer "rewards," depending on the amount you pledge. For example, if you pledge $25 to help back the project, we'll offer you a copy of the game along with any stretch goals we achieve as soon as it is manufactured. 
You can become a backer in just three easy steps: 
Step 1: Read through the pledge levels and rewards we're offering in the right sidebar of this page. 
Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page. 
Step 3: Enter your pledge amount, and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds! That's it! It's really that simple! Thank you for backing! 
Once you've backed this project, we encourage you to share this page on social media platforms, such as Facebook and Twitter, and share with your friends and family. Also, be sure to like Indie Boards and Cards on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for real-time updates about this project and more! 
CITIZEN: (Pledge $1 or more) Your continued support will help the superheroes of Zeta City!
HERO: (Pledge $25 or more) One copy of Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger with all stretch goals. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates below. 
SIDEKICK: (Pledge $70 or more) One of all Heroes Wanted expansions - Extra Extra, Heroes Wanted: The Stuff of Legend, Breaking News, and Champions & Masterminds 1 & 2, as well as One copy of Elements of Danger with all of the stretch goals. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates below.
CHAMPION: (Pledge $100 or more) One of all Heroes Wanted games - Heroes Wanted, Extra Extra, Heroes Wanted: The Stuff of Legend, Breaking News, and Champions & Masterminds 1 & 2. As well as One copy of Elements of Danger with all of the stretch goals. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates below. 
We are not expecting to release Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger expansion into retail. Kickstarter and conventions will be the only way to get the expansion in 2017. Any remaining copies from the small print run will sold directly by us via conventions and Amazon sales in 2018.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the 39th Kickstarter project from the combined teams behind Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games. We have learned how to streamline the game publishing process and have successfully delivered all of our previous Kickstarter projects to thousands of supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Just a quick update on the US side of the final fulfillment for Elements of Danger. I know that there are always a lot of concerns for those that haven't gotten a shipping notice when others have received their games. 
 First, lots of shipping notices get caught in spam folders, and many people don't check their kickstarter email address - so check there;) I am confident that Amazon is sending notices when packages are shipping.  
Second, the way Amazon ships items may not be intuitive - its a multi step process:

A quick shipping update - shipping has started, and most packages will be sent this week. 
Shipping Update  
For the US - Amazon received the first of two shipments last week, and started sending out packages to those in mid-Atlantic states of Virginia and Carolinas. This morning they started shipping out packages to all the East Coast states. The second shipment is due to arrive to the Amazon warehouse in Dallas late tonight, and will start shipping from there through this week and into next. All shipments will receive a shipping notice when they go out, and shipments will start with those closest to Dallas and radiate from there (so the farther from Dallas you live, the later you will receive your shipping notice).

Just a quick update.  
Its been a busy week, in the US we saw our container arrive and should be moving from the port to our warehouse by Friday. From there the backer copies for US will be sent to Amazon and then to you, and Canadian copies (and any Heroes Wanted games and expansions) will be sent to Snakes and Lattes in Toronto.

Hello citizens,
I'm pleased to announce that we received the production sample last week, and it looks great! Here's a picture:

Good morning, citizens!
I want to apologize for the radio silence since the end of the campaign. We had a super busy Gencon to deal with.
On to the good news, due to how awesome you guys were, we were able to unlock all of the stretch goals. You guys really made this campaign outperform our expectations, so thank you! More good news, we submitted the print files last week, so, for now, we are on schedule to deliver on time in December of this year. We let you know the progress of the project as milestones are met.

updates.update_userinfo: The Final Hours, Getting More than One Game & Managing Your Pledge!
updates.update_content:
Hello, all! 
We are in the last few days of the campaign and super excited to see this project come to life! You’ve all done an amazing job promoting Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger on social media! 
The most frequent question I am getting as the project comes to a close is: "How do I get more than one copy of Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger with all the Kickstarter extras?" or "Will there be a pledge manager for $1 backers?"

Good afternoon, citizens!  
We continue to steadily fund and unlock more stretch content! 
First up, let’s take a look at 2 SGs that unlocked some dastardly Pros and Ex-Cons.

Good afternoon, citizens! 
Elements of Danger launched yesterday and funded in a few hours! WOWZA! 
First and foremost, thanks to all you amazing citizens, new and old, for your support. It's truly amazing to see the response to this expansion. We can’t wait to share these new elemental abilities with you!

campaign.story:
Resources are dwindling. Overpopulation is destroying the planet. Time is running out. Elite factions are exploring the cosmos for a new home, new technology, new allies, or the resources needed to repair the plight of their damaged home world. With nothing left to lose and on the brink of madness, these warring Earthlings, equipped with deep-space warships with expansive cargo holds, will do whatever it takes to claim the glory for saving humanity...Before The Earth Explodes!   
Before The Earth Explodes uses clever tactics and intuition to secure victory in 1 of 4 ways:  
*Advance to the top of the Tech Track  
*Colonize 7 new planets  
*Destroy the opposing faction  
*Meet a variable victory condition revealed during play
In the game, players choose actions simultaneously to determine their course of play. Using a Rock-Paper-Scissors-style of action resolution, a scout will attack an invading ship while an invading ship will damage an away party or a mining vessel while a mining vessel will defend itself against a scout. If a player is able to avoid taking damage they will get to carry out special actions based on the card played. These actions allow players to increase their technology level, encounter an ally ship, clone an opponent's ability, take control of a new planet, or mine for resources.
Before the Earth Explodes is 2-player space epic in a small package. Each game takes 20-30 minutes to play. The game was created by the prolific design team and members of Game Artisans of Canada, Daryl Andrews and Adrian Adamescu (Sagrada, Mine All Mines, and the upcoming Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Showdown).
Game Setup:
Here's a basic rundown on how the game is played (see video above for more in depth overview!):
  Players choose and reveal their action cards simultaneously.
  At the beginning of this phase, players resolve the icons on the portion of the card with the image.
  In Phase 1, players may gain ship cards, deal damage, and cancel their opponent's action.
  As long as players haven't been dealt damage they may resolve their actions (on the bottom portion of the card) in alphabetical order.
    Next, as long as they haven't been damaged, players may spend resources to colonize a planet. Planets provide one-time use abilities as well as move players towards victory.
  In the final phase, resources, planet cards, and ship cards are refilled to prepare for the next round.
  There are several paths to victory that require outthinking your opponent and being attentive and flexible to the changing landscape or the game!
 Check out Jason giving an overview at Origins Game Fair:
    As with every Green Couch Games title, we try to pack a big experience into a small box so you can easily get our games to the table with casual and hardcore gamer's alike!
We think Before The Earth Explodes is GREAT but don't just take our word for it! Check out this previews and other helpful links! (Please note that all pictures use prototype components and don't always reflect the final product.)
  "The art is amazing. The feel of the game is super cool. It plays very fast. This has very tactical decisions to be made for an overall strategic goal." -Chris Kirkman, The State of Games Podcast.
  "Before The Earth Explodes is a really fun, tight 2-player experience. Its mechanisms are simple and easy to manage, its table footprint is small, and its playtime is short – essentially the perfect combination of traits for a ‘throw it in your backpack’ game you can play anywhere you have a little bit of flat surface to claim. This one’s a winner." -Gameosity.com
Cloak and Meeple shares their preview here and strange things occur:
                        "I like that there are a variety of ways to win, even in this compact, quick-playing game. You really do get to pick which of the 4 Xs (Explore, Expand, Exploit, Exterminate) you want to focus on—but you have to mix it up so that your opponent doesn’t guess what you’re up to." -Jonathan Liu, Geek Dad
"Before the Earth Explodes successfully fits a head-to-head two player game with conflict, the potential for evolving strategies, and an element of intuition into a tight, enjoyable 20-minute filler experience." -Married with Board Games 
Check out their whole video here:
                                                            "It was a mind game trying to figure out what card you can safely play...Every action you take in this game feels enormous...It's great! It feels epic!" -Craig, Botch Cast
Listen to the full review at the 23 minute mark: http://directory.libsyn.com/episode/index/id/5583086
  "Every time we've played this game we've gone and played it again right away...Green Couch Games just does an awesome job with these small box games!" -Draft Mechanic Podcast
Brian's Got Game share their thoughts on the game right here:
                                          Brandon Kempf gives an overview on the What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing. Check it out around the20 minute mark: http://directory.libsyn.com/episode/index/id/5593044 
Tantrum House says "With so many ships and planets the game has immense replayability," Check out their preview here:
Check out this overview from Stephane and Tracy of To Die For Games:
  Without your help, we wouldn't get to make all these great little games. Here are the options for getting on board to help make Before The Earth Explodes a reality. Hurry, before we run out of time!
         At the Captain Level and beyond, your pledge includes a killer custom playmat for organizing your play area! These playmats are cloth with rubber backing and measure 12" by 18" and 1/16" in thickness. These will not be available in stores!
You can add-on one of our previous games by adjusting the amount of your pledge! The prices below include shipping. You can add this amount to your pledged amount and we'll collect information about the games you added at the end of the campaign. We'll also ship the add-on games out before Before The Earth Explodes, right after we receive the funds (about two-three weeks after the Kickstarter closes).  
Here's the prices including shipping (which are cheaper than buying them from our webstore): 
                        Before The Earth Explodes is available world-wide and all copies will ship from within the US! International Shipping fees will be added to your pledge level when you select your home location.  
Added Shipping as follows:
Explorer Pledge Level: US-Included!, Canada-$5, Everywhere Else-$8 
Captain and General Pledge Level: US-Included!, Canada-$10, Everywhere Else-$17 
Note: International Backers will be responsible for any import fees, brokerage or delivery surcharges, or applicable taxes that may be levied after we have shipped your package. However, this campaign is CUSTOMS FRIENDLY. The low price point and small box for this game should not cause any customs fees for backers pledging for 1-2 copies. We have learned that shipping is a costly endeavor, especially with the recent rate increase in the US Postal Service, and we must try to keep our costs as low as possible to keep our games at an appropriate price point for when they hit retail.  
We are saying THANK YOU to our early adopters on Kickstarter by offering the game below MSRP while covering the first $5 of shipping costs for all backers. We'll also be adding some extra content at no extra charge (when we reach STRETCH GOALS, of course).
We have plans to add value (STRETCH GOALS!) to Before The Earth Explodes that we think you will really appreciate. We plan to add value by upgrading components to make this cool game even cooler! We have several stretch goals in mind and we hope to hit them all! But know that just as with our previous campaigns, we won't likely be adding more just to add more. We believe that more isn't always better, especially if it holds up production and delays delivery.  
That being said, we'll be listening closely to your feedback and ideas and will carefully consider all the ideas that comes our way.  
Here's a peek at the first couple stretch goals! We'll announce more and funding thresholds as we get closer to funding!
The cloth resource bag is unlocked! Onward and upward!
Custom wooden tie breaker token is unlocked! To the cosmos!
At $9000, we upgraded to a box cover with Spot UV to help the awesome artwork standout even more! 
Spot UV is a process that involves adding a varnish to specific spots of the printed material to draw the eye's attention and give it a super fantastic visual pop and added texture.
At $10,000 we'll have the game logo added to the cloth resource bag!
At $11,000, we'll increase the size of the player boards from standard sized cards to tarot sized cards!
If you've checked out the videos and read the reviews and still want more info, you can check out the Work-in-Progress Rules PDF RIGHT HERE! The rules are currently being edited and reformatted for clarity and to match the feel of the art and graphic design.  
The rules are hosted on BoardGameGeek and will require a free account to download. But if you like games, BGG is the place to be so head over there now to get plugged into the world-wide gaming community!
   Thanks for your pledge and for helping us spread the word! Sharing about the project on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Reddit, and other networks you are a part of goes a long way!  
Here are some cool avatars to use on your favorite social media site:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My experience with our previous campaigns, Fidelitas, Best Treehouse Ever, JurassAttack!, Avalanche at Yeti Mountain, Wok on Fire, Rocky Road a la Mode, OutLawed!, and Ladder 29 has provided a solid foundation for me to build on. And so far I have been able to avoid delays and common pitfalls by paying special attention to the following areas and building on previous experience:

Art and Design. The art and design for the game is nearly complete so we'll be ready to print shortly after the close of the campaign. I always like to show you I mean business by paying for the art and design upfront!

Playtesting and Reviewing. Before The Earth Explodes has been tested by many different playtesters and even a bunch of game designers. I have sent a bunch of prototypes to a variety of reviewers. I want to earn your trust by providing you with a solid product that has been thoroughly tested and reviewed by folks from varying backgrounds and perspectives.

Past Experience. This is the tenth Kickstarter project I've run for Green Couch Games and I have helped with several other successful campaigns. Also, having spent many years working in retail and customer service, I understand the importance of treating backers with respect and following through with projects.

Of course, there are always unexpected circumstances that pop up, but I PROMISE to communicate every step of the way and do my best to use creative problem solving meet the challenges head on.

Thank you so much for giving Green Couch Games a chance. As a small company, I truly can't do this without you. I will do my best to thank you by creating great little games that you love to play.

Sincerely, 
Jason Kotarski, founder of Green Couch Games
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Another great Sci-Fi game from Green Couch Games!
updates.update_content:
Hello!
I hope you all are enjoying your attempt at saving our planet with Before the Earth Explodes! It's important work that only YOU can do!
I wanted to pop by to make sure you heard about our latest game, Darwinauts, that is currently wrapping up on Kickstarter! It's a bigger boxed game for 1-4 players, designed by Chris Bryan with artwork by Vincent Dutrait! The game includes worker placement, set collection, area control and solo play in about 30-40 minutes. It's already funded and unlocking lots of fun stretch goals with just a couple days left in the campaign!

updates.update_userinfo: Games have landed...in my living room! +Geekway to the West Pick Up!
updates.update_content:
Alright!
Copies of Before The Earth Explodes have docked in a temporary location to rest and refuel before embarking on a mission to their final destinations...your game table!
That's right, I have games piled up in my living room and fulfillment will begin in earnest next week!

Hey Explorers!
I finally have some more concrete information about the status of Before The Earth Explodes. 
First, let me say that manufacturing and shipping has taken quite a bit longer than I initially anticipated. I apologize for that. My previous campaigns have all delivered on time (within a couple weeks of my estimated delivery) so I am disappointed to break my streak with this one.

updates.update_userinfo: Before The Earth Explodes Unboxing on The Dice Tower...and another sweet treat!
updates.update_content:
Hey Space Cadets!
I just caught wind of this new Unboxing Video of Before The Earth Explodes on the Dice Tower! This was one of a handful of advance copies I received to send out for review. 
We are still expecting the game to arrive on the shores of the US any day now and shipping will commence shortly after that!

Hey space geeks!
After having been closed fora several weeks due to the Chinese New Year, our printer has re-opened and has informed me that production is complete and that the games will be loaded on to the big vessel to make their journey across the ocean at the end of this week!
In a few weeks (3-6 weeks), our warehouse will receive those and fulfillment will commence!

Hello Spacerfarers! 
A very special shipment arrived this morning!

Hey folks,
Not much to report but it's been just over a month since the last update so I wanted to keep all of you in the loop. We are still awaiting a hard proof of Before The Earth Explodes from the printer any day. They told me I should see something this week. As soon as I have it in my hands, I'll be back with more info.

Hello Daring Spacefarers!
I just wanted to pop by with a quick update about Before The Earth Explodes.
All of the files were submitted and we received digital proofs that we needed to make some corrections on for the printer. After going back and forth on a few things, we're looking good. Now we are waiting for a hard copy proof to inspect the components and see how everything is coming together in the physical realm. As soon as we get that in our hands, we'll be sure to come back with some pictures or video to share with you all.

Hey Citizens of Earth,
We are please to announce that our mission is nearly complete as the files for Before The Earth Explodes have been finalized and will be sent off to the factory which will begin the production phase for the game!
Next, we will receive digital proofs and soft proofs that give us a chance to see how the colors turned out and make sure everything is in order before printing begins.

Mission accomplished!
Last night marks the end of a successful mission to fund Before The Earth Explodes!
Thank you so much for your support and participation. We're really excited to get this game made and to your gaming tables!

campaign.story:
Ninjitsu! is a quick and simple card game suitable for ninjas as young as 8. A sequel to last year's hit game Scuttle!, the two games can be played separately or shuffled together for pirate-ninja mayhem!
Ninjitsu! takes 5-10 minutes to play, and each game is totally different.
All stretch goals unlocked, including:
10 additional promo cards, which won't be available in the retail copy of the game!
A free additional expansion for anyone backing at the NINJA MASTER level or higher!
Linen-finish cards, tuck boxes for the expansions, and a larger, sturdier box!
8 unique arts added to the base game + expansions!
All pledges at the NINJA MASTER level or higher will get a free copy of Heavy Weather, a new 14-card expansion that adds fun weather effects to the game!
"Simultaneously simple, devious, and rich in strategy...a great game for anyone of any age." - GeekDad
"Ninjitsu! is simple, to the point, fast, and fun...expect this game to surprise you with its stealthy entertainment." - Father Geek
"It’s a great game. Definitely check this one out - if you own Scuttle!, this is a must-buy.” - Brian's Got Game
"Suitable and interesting for all ages...Ninjitsu! excels." - Plumpy Thimble
"I was impressed with the level of complexity in such a simple package." - Peace Love & Games
"The kids can enjoy it, the parents can enjoy it - it's just all round fun and cute!" - The Kwaranteen
"An aggressive, fun, and addictive punk rock experience. The Ramones would love this game." - Nonstop Tabletop
“I really enjoyed the game - looking forward to playing some more!” - Stephane
“It’s a twist on some of the old, classic card games…it makes it new and fun and adds some new mechanics.” - Tracy
-To Die For Games
Each turn in Ninjitsu! is simple - you either play a card, draw 2 cards, or swipe a treasure from an opponent. That’s it! Cards can be played as treasure or as an action. Every card has a different ability, and the first player to reach 21 treasure is the winner.
Ninjitsu! is fully compatible with Scuttle! - just shuffle the two games together and you're ready to go! Itintroduces hidden treasures, which are played face-down in front of you. These can be stolen by your opponents, but watch out! Some hidden treasures are trapped; swipe the wrong card, and pay the consequences!
Check out the free print-and-play!
Everyone who gets the game through Kickstarter will also be sent a special promo card: Jellybean Ninja. 
This colorful character lets you guess what treasure you’re stealing. If you’re correct, you are rewarded with a great bounty!
Our stretch goals will unlock other promo cards as well - check out the stretch goal chart below! 
Like all Jellybean Games, Ninjitsu! is simple enough for young gamers to enjoy, but with enough strategy to engage grown-ups as well. The hidden treasures add a unique bluffing element to the game and keep everyone engaged at all times. 
Is that treasure going to guarantee your opponent victory...or is it a carefully laid trap? There’s only one way to find out! 
The Traps! expansion offers 14 new cards, including a whole new type of trap: cards with long-lasting effects! Stealing treasure has never been so risky, with new traps which prevent you from drawing, swiping, or even playing hidden treasures of your own!
With more treasure, more ninjas (the fiendish Master of Tricks, the devious Master Thief, and the dastardly Master of Escape) and more ways to bamboozle your opponents, this Ninjitsu! expansion will totally change the way you play the game. 
An ancient grimoire has been uncovered, unleashing the secrets of elemental magic! These 15 cards add a unique twist to the game, and can be shuffled into any game of Ninjitsu! OR Scuttle! to add a little magic touch.
Give yourself the power of Flight, Alchemy, Healing, and more! The magical tome’s abilities will leave your opponents stunned as you duplicate your cards, transmute treasures, and invisibly steal their cards…
Combining either Traps! or the Supernatural expansion with Ninjitsu! adds the fourth suit to the game, which means the game can be used as a standard deck of playing cards.
Seize the powers of the elements with these unique player abilities! Master the forces of nature to crush your opponents.
At the start of each game, each player is dealt an element - they choose which of the two elemental powers to use and play the rest of the game with that ability.
Will you use the powers of Fire to protect your treasure, or to steal cards from your opponents? Will your Earthly abilities give you a boost at the start of the game, or grow your treasures? Will the power of Heart be enough to overcome your opponents? There’s only one way to find out!
We have unlocked ALL of our stretch goals! Thank you so much for your support!
UNLOCKED - $3,000 - FUNDED:  Ninjitsu! and its expansions are going to be printed and sent out to backers, along with the promo Jellybean Ninja card! 
UNLOCKED - $5,000 - CAPTAIN BLUEBEARD: We've added an additional promo card: Captain Bluebeard! This piratey fellow has the ability to steal all of an opponent's hidden treasures in one fell swoop!
UNLOCKED - $7,000 - UPGRADED BOX: The box for Ninjitsu! has been upgraded to a strong, sturdy, telescoping box, with the same dimensions as Scuttle!'s box.
UNLOCKED - $9,000 - UPGRADED CARD QUALITY: We'll be making the cards sturdier, thicker, and easier to shuffle!
UNLOCKED - $11,000 - LINEN-FINISH CARDS: The Ninjitsu! cards will be given a gorgeous linen finish. 
UNLOCKED - $13,000 - NINJA TURTLE PROMO: What does every game with ninjas need? Turtles! 
UNLOCKED - $15,000 - FALSE FLOOR PROMO: We've unlocked another promo card. These cards won't be available in retail copies of the game, and will come in an exclusive Promo Pack!
UNLOCKED - $20,000 - THE ELEMENTS EXPANDED: Another promo card has been unlocked. This card will be a new player power for The Elements mini-expansion: Elemental Magic!
UNLOCKED - $30,000 - THE ELEMENTS DOUBLE-SIDED: The Elements mini-expansion will now be double-sided: two powers on every card, including the newly-unlocked Magic ability!
UNLOCKED - $40,000 - NEW ACES: Each Ace in the base game will be unique!
UNLOCKED - $50,000 - EXPANSIONS IN TUCK BOXES: The two expansions will come in cool unique tuck boxes, each of them big enough to house the whole game!
UNLOCKED - $60,000 - HEAVY WEATHER MINI-EXPANSION: All backers at the NINJA MASTER level and above will get a FREE copy of the Heavy Weather mini-expansion!
UNLOCKED $65,000 - HEAT WAVE ADDED TO HEAVY WEATHER: We're adding another card to the Heavy Weather mini-expansion; the Heat Wave! This card slows down the player with the most cards in play. 
UNLOCKED $70,000 - UNIQUE ART ON BOTH SIDES OF THE ELEMENTS: We have now DOUBLED the amount of art in The Elements mini-expansion, with unique art on each side of each card - including the MAGIC promo card!
UNLOCKED - $75,000 - HURRICADE ADDED TO HEAVY WEATHER: Hurricane has been added to the Heavy Weather mini-expansion. The Hurricane makes all players shuffle a card into the deck, as well as mixing up the entire weather deck!
UNLOCKED - $80,000 - RAINBOW ADDED TO HEAVY WEATHER: Rainbow has been added into the Heavy Weather mini-expansion; this generous card gives each players TWO ACTIONS per turn...but no one can win the game until it leaves play!
UNLOCKED - $87,796 - THREE MORE NINJA TURTLES: We're adding THREE MORE Ninja Turtles as promos, one for each suit! These tricky fellows will let you take vital actions out of turn!
UNLOCKED - $89,188 - VAMPIRE NINJA PROMO: If we can beat our all-time Kickstarter record (currently held by Dracula's Feast), we'll add another promo to the game - the Vampire Ninja!
UNLOCKED - $95,000 - BLIZZARD ADDED TO HEAVY WEATHER: We have added another weather card to Heavy Weather. The Blizzard is a real equalizer, giving all players the same number of cards in hand as the player with the fewest cards!
Heavy Weather is now a full-sized expansion!
UNLOCKED - $100k - TWO HEAVY WEATHER PROMO CARDS ADDED: We've added Aurora Borealis and Ball Lightning to the promo pack, two promo cards for the Heavy Weather expansion!
(NOTE: We are currently experiencing an error with our pledge levels: if you're pledging for the NINJA MASTER pledge level from the US, please pick the first reward level - the one with the itemized list! If you're pledging from outside the US, please select the second one!)
$1 - APPRENTICE: Support the project! This will let you keep up with the project updates, and give you access to the pledge manager.
$9 - NINJA: Just the game! This level will get you a copy of Ninjitsu!, the Promo Pack. ($5 shipping US, $10 international.)
$14 - SHINOBI: The game + either expansion! This will get you a copy of Ninjitsu! and either the Supernatural expansion or the Traps! expansion. This pledge level also includes the Promo Pack. ($5 shipping US, $10 international.)
$19 - NINJA MASTER: The game + both expansions! Get Ninjitsu!, both expansions, and a copy of the mini-expansion The Elements. This pledge level also includes the Promo Pack, and a FREE third expansion - Heavy Weather - unlocked through stretch goals. ($5 shipping US, $10 international.)
$39 - PIRATE NINJA: Both games + all expansions! Get Ninjitsu!, both expansions, the mini-expansion The Elements, Scuttle!, and both Scuttle! expansions! This pledge level also includes the Promo Pack, and a FREE third expansion - Heavy Weather - unlocked through stretch goals. ($5 shipping US, $10 international.)
$49 - ONIWABAN: Three copies of the game + both expansions! Three copies of Ninjitsu!, three copies of Traps!, three copies of the Supernatural expansion, three copies of The Elements, and three copies of the Promo Pack and three copies of the FREE third expansion - Heavy Weather - unlocked through stretch goals. ($10 shipping US, $15 international.) 
$99 - WAR: Three copies of both games + all expansions! Three copies of Ninjitsu! and both expansions, three copies of Scuttle! and both expansions, and three copies of The Elements, the Promo Pack and three copies of the FREE third expansion - Heavy Weather - unlocked through stretch goals.($10 shipping US, $15 international.)
$499 - BECOME A NINJA: Appear on a card! A copy of Ninjitsu!, both expansions, The Elements, the Promo Pack, the Heavy Weather expansion, PLUS Kelly will draw you onto one of the game's cards. You'll get a copy of the digital file, and your card will be included in the Promo Pack. (Free worldwide shipping)
$999 - NINJA CLAN: Your whole family on a card! A copy of Ninjitsu!, both expansions, The Elements, the Promo Pack, the Heavy Weather expansion, and Kelly will draw you and three others onto a card! You'll get a copy of the digital file, and your card will be included in the Promo Pack. (Free worldwide shipping)
Add-ons: 
If you'd like additional copies of Ninjitsu! or Scuttle!, simply increase your pledge, and the extra items will be added into your order when the campaign closes.
$10 - Ninjitsu! add $10 to your pledge to get an additional copy of Ninjitsu! and the Promo Pack.
$20 - Ninjitsu! + expansions: Add $20 to your pledge to get an additional copy of Ninjitsu!, all three expansions, The Elements, and the Promo Pack.
$20 - Scuttle! + expansions: Add $20 to your pledge to get a copy of Scuttle! with both expansions
I love Kickstarter. I've backed many of my favorite games through the platform, and thanks to the community we built with our previous projects, Jellybean Games is able to continue its mission: to make family-friendly games for everyone.
Ninjitsu! is our fourth game, and we’re so excited to share it with everyone. But without your support, we can’t make it! As you can see from the review copies, the game is fully designed, the rules rule, and the art is all complete; all we want now is your help to print the game and distribute it around the world.
Ninjitsu! is the fifth project from Jellybean Games. The company was formed to bring you awesome experiences for gamer kids (and their parents) which can also be enjoyed by the wider gaming community.
Our aim is to make games for kids that grown-ups love.
All the money we raise will go towards making Ninjitsu! even better, and furthering development on all our future games.
If you like the game, please support the project (every dollar helps!) and tell your friends...especially if they have kids, know kids, love kids, or love great games and gorgeous art!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our first game, Scuttle!, delivered on-time to most backers (and only slightly late to the rest). 
Our second game, Dracula’s Feast, is now shipping.
Our third game, The Lady and the Tiger, is about to hit the printer.

We have learned a lot of valuable lessons from our first few campaigns, and we are confident that this game will arrive by the anticipated delivery date at the very latest. The game has been going through playtesting for months now, and the vast majority of the art is complete.

Once the campaign wraps up, all we need to do is put the finishing touches on everything, and send it to the printer!

That’s it!

We are renowned for keeping our backers in the loop through our comprehensive updates. When you back a Jellybean Games campaign, you know you’re in good hands!

As well as that, we are offering a money-back guarantee. If you decide that Ninjitsu! isn’t for you within a month of receiving it, you can return it for a full refund, no questions asked.

If you have any questions about any part of the campaign, you can message us through Kickstarter or email contact@jellybean-games.com for a prompt response.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Vikingar! - The Final Treasure Hunters Game
updates.update_content:
Hey!
It's been almost a year since the last update to this campaign, and so I just wanted to pop back in and give you the various pieces of Treasure Hunters news that have occurred since then.
(If you don't want to get these updates, every email you get offers a handy link to unsubscribe! Just scroll to the bottom, and look for the link. :)

updates.update_userinfo: Meow! has 3 days left on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hey Ninja-fans!
It's been a while since I updated - you'll be glad to know that Ninjitsu! continues to do well. I play it a lot (particularly at cons) and it's just one of my favourite games I've designed. Is that okay to say? Hopefully, cos I'm saying it!
That's right: I, Peter C. Hayward, designer of Ninjitsu!, quite like the game. You heard it here first.

Hey!
As I mentioned in our last update, Brains! is now live on Kickstarter. Some people were a little confused by how it worked, so I thought I’d dive in and give some more details:
The Treasure Hunters series (named by Night1505 in the comments of this very campaign) wasn’t always intended to be a series! The first game,, was based on a game I used to play as a kid, (which, obviously, was not a series).

updates.update_userinfo: All Ninjitsu! copies have been sent, and the newest Treasure Hunters game!
updates.update_content:
Hey!
Before I get into the meat of today's update, I have exciting news: Brains!, the newest game in the Treasure Hunters line just went live on Kickstarter!

Hey!
We've been getting some concerned comments from people who have received their pledges but are missing certain items. If this is you, read on!
CANADIAN BACKERS: For some reason, Scuttle! items didn't go out in the initial shipment wave! (Also, if you ordered 3 copies of the game, you may have only received 1). Snakes and Lattes, who are fulfilling these orders for us, are on top of it - . A follow-up shipment with the correct items is already on its way!

Hey everyone!
This update in brief: Games continue to ship, people are having a great time with them, and I answer some questions.
Shipping Update

updates.update_userinfo: Games are arriving! Here is EVERYTHING YOU NEED TO KNOW
updates.update_content:
Hey! 
Games have started landing at people’s houses! That’s right - games are here, and they are beautiful.
We've been getting some questions, so I thought I'd go through and answer all of them in a single place:
Where is my game?

We just received confirmation from Quartermaster Logistics that fulfillment has begun for our U.S. backers! They expect all U.S. packages to be shipped out by Friday, August 17th.
Shipments from our EU, Australia, Asia and Canada depots shouldn’t be far behind -- we’re just waiting for the official confirmation from each depot (and we’ll let you know as soon as we receive it!).

updates.update_userinfo: How-to-play video, shipping update, Gen Con!
updates.update_content:
Hey!
A bunch of news comin’ atcha, so I’m going to launch straight into it. First things first: I just finished putting together the How to Play video for Ninjitsu!
It runs you through the basics, shows off how pretty the game is, and allows you to listen to my adorable Australian accent. What more could anyone ever want in a video?
How to Play :

Hey!
All kinds of news today - mostly boat-related. Let's go!
Firstly - as a few people tracking shipments have observed - the US boat has landed!
That’s right, the Qingdao Coffee is no more! The people who own the ship were  about delivering our games, they realized that the boat’s life had peaked, and there was not even any point in continuing to run it.

Re your issue about confusion. Sabotage would be a better word than destroy. Still states it's rendered unusable.

@Vascariz I don't really see how Destoy is not child friendly in the context its used. "Hide" would mean there is access to it, "Squirrel Away" maybe if it was a book for a 3year old but not a card game. "Its destroyed! "- no more treasure, no need to look for or one can have it, gone for good - there's no questioning about it. My kids(fact) would ask "how to get it back"," I hid it it counts for my points." I know were your coming from as I had to choose games wisely too but its really in the context of the meaning. "I destroyed the Pirate!" No good. "I Destroyed the Pirate Treasure!" Destroy- to ruin, to defeat, put an end to something for good. I started my kids gaming before they could read, I had to cover some of my game boxes because of art work. They now know which games are Daddy's and don't play and have learned the differences between a game and reality. I comend you on looking out for what the little ones are introduced to, many don't. And I don't want to sound as I'm putting your views down, I might not agree but that's were it stops. Im a parent too and definitely know every parent and every kid is different. I can't want to change your view, I just voice my view and maybe you contemplate mine and maybe not. Gaming with your kids is awsome don't stop. :-)
