campaign.story:
In Crabs!, you and your fellow crabbers will be catching, raising, and selling crabs to the market for points. Get ready to gather your gear and head to the beach, where vendors are lining up to collect the crabs you catch. Choose your prizes wisely, and you might just shell out the shellfish they need. Race to snatch up as many crabs as you can, or upgrade your gear to improve your chances of nabbing yourself a star. Compete with your friends to find out who is the true crabbing king.
Shuffle up the crab cards and deal out a hand of cards to each player and then form the crab pool. Players will then take turns trying to raise or catch the right crabs to sell to the market.
The first player to accumulate 25 points on their turn triggers the final round. Whoever has the most points by the end of that round, wins the game.
This 30mb PDF file contains the draft rules, and all of the cards. Everything you need to play Crabs! Click here to download it now.
Be sure to post a comment about your game experiences so that other backers can admire your catch of crustaceans.
      24 Vendor cards
Up to 5 available personalized Vendor cards 
     Game Contents:
60 Crab cards
24 Vendor cards
5 Reference cards
1 Crabbing Permit
5 Crab tokens
Kickstarter Limited Exclusive:
      1 Screen-printed 1st Player token 
5 Extra Vendor Cards
5 Crab Promo Cards for Food Truck Champion
  Click to read the full review
 
            Click to read the full review
    Click to read the full review
                      We have several cool stretch goals planned and will reveal them as the campaign continues. If you have any suggestions/ideas, we are excited to hear them! Please post them in the comments section on what you'd like to see in the game. 
                                         We like to support game stores by offering the Kickstarter versions of our games to retailers during the campaign. We know money can be tight for retailers, so the amount you pledge today is only a deposit on the full amount. We'll send you an invoice for the remainder before we ship your rewards. We treat retailer backers just like other backers in that they receive their rewards before we release the regular retail versions into distribution, giving you a head start on your competition. You can see the Retailer 12-Pack pledge level in the right-side column of this project page.
Every game we create is a discrete project with its own development schedule and it's own budget of production and marketing expenses. We bring each project to Kickstarter to give you, our fans and supporters, the opportunity to help us put the final touches on the game and to reserve your copies at the time when it will do the game the most good, both financially and creatively. 
Some say that a creator should not launch a new project until their previous project is completed and delivered. That system might work for a designer who is self-publishing a game, but for an up-and-coming company like Daily Magic Games, that system is not viable. At any point in time we are working on a dozen projects in various stages of completion. Right now, for example...
Merchants of Araby delivered to most backers 2 months early, was debuted at Origins 2017, and hits retail stores on July 26th.
10 Minute Heist: The Wizard's Tower delivered to most backers 2 months early, will debut at GenCon 2017, and hits retail stores on September 20th.
Go Nuts for Donuts is being fulfilled on time by GameWright, our worldwide publishing partner.
Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Flames & Frost is shipping now to most backers, will debut at GenCon 2017, and hits retail stores in October. 
Food Truck Champion is at the printer and we expect to deliver to backers in October. We also expect to debut Food Truck Champion at EssenSpiel 2017 and release it to retail stores in November.
Sailing Toward Osiris is finishing translations into German, French, and Spanish. 
Crabs! is on Kickstarter now. 
Horizons is in the hands of game reviewers and is coming to Kickstarter on August 29th. 
Sarah’s Singularity is in final testing and is scheduled for Kickstarter in 4Q2017. 
Alchemea is in beta testing and is scheduled for Kickstarter in 1Q2018. 
Corsairs: A Valeria Adventure is in beta testing. 
Spaceways is in beta testing. 
Chocolatiers is in alpha testing. 
Peddlers is in alpha testing.
We're hoping that our track record for successfully completing and delivering previous projects will give you the confidence to support Crabs!, and that the forthright communications we present when projects do hit snags will assuage any fears that we're going to screw it all up.
Daily Magic Games is a designer-friendly and customer-focused publisher specializing in casual tabletop games that are easy to learn and play, yet layered with strategy and depth.  
Isaias Vallejo, Wizard-in-Chief, Game Designer, and Developer
David MacKenzie, Conjurer, Game Developer, and Prototyper
Levi Mote, Alchemist, Game Designer, and Developer 
Sarah Sharp, Enchantress and Convention Event Planner 
Dylan Pharaoh-Whitney, Sorcerer and Graphic Designer
Claire Donaldson, Illusionist, Illustrator, and Graphic Designer 
We are focused on listening to what our customers have to say and making sure that we are producing the type of games you want at the high quality you demand. We are actively involved in the Comments section of each Kickstarter and keep backers up to date with plenty of updates post-Kickstarter. We like to make casual and gateway games in an effort to get more people to the table. Our games are easy to learn to help new players get in to the game faster, but they're also layered with strategy for the more seasoned players. We're based out of Seattle, Washington and like to focus on the growth and promotion of game design in the Pacific Northwest. We've even started a playtesting event network called PlaytestNW to help local designers meet each other and engage with playtesters on a regular basis. Our hope is that we're helping designers build better games.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Daily Magic Games is committed to delivering quality products on time. We realize that the publication of a board game can be complicated and, no matter how experienced the project creators and mangers are, some problems may occur. In an effort to reduce the likelihood of delays and mistakes, we have taken several steps to prepare for success:

1. This game project, as well as the Kickstarter campaign itself, are in the hands of two well-seasoned professionals. David MacKenzie has been running successful Kickstarter projects since 2010 (Alien Frontiers started the gaming frenzy on Kickstarter), and Isaias Vallejo comes from a digital games background as Executive Producer at Big Fish Games and has designed several successful board games (Sunrise City and the "Valeria" series of games).

2. We are dedicated to backer communication and feedback. Throughout every campaign, we are as transparent about the process and as open to feedback as possible without jeopardizing production and delivery timelines. Whether the news is good or bad, you can expect us to report it honestly and openly.

3. We have done significant pre-production. All the art and graphic design for Crabs! are completed with the exception of the stretch goals content. The art and design for the stretch goals content has been sketched out and is ready to push forward as soon as each goal is achieved.

4. We have our manufacturer lined up and ready to begin the pre-press process as soon as the files are delivered. We hope that everything goes as planned, but if something falls through the cracks, we are ready and willing to employ every tool at our disposal to get the project back on track and running smoothly.

Thank you for your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings Crabbers...
Hopefully, you're enjoying your backer copy of Crabs! If so, please take a moment and give it a rating and comment on its BoardGameGeek page or it's Amazon page.

Greetings Crabbers...
The Crabs rewards are finally ready to ship. The inventory has been delivered to Send From China and the backer shipping data has been uploaded. I expect the orders to begin shipping next week.  
Shipping from China takes about 20 days, so everyone should have their rewards by the end of July.

Greetings Crabbers...
Well, I had expected to have CRABS! shipping out to backers by now, but final assembly has been taking much longer than expected. I'm now expecting it to be wrapped up and the stock delivered to SendFromChina by the end of May. I'll keep you posted as soon as I have more information.
Villages of Valeria: Landmarks

Greetings Crabbers!
We received the assembly proofs from our manufacturer, today. Overall, everything looks great. There are a few packing corrections needed, but that's not a big deal. I expect that they'll be able to get these wrapped up by the end of April and then send them off to Send From China for fulfillment. You should have the games in-hand before the end of May.

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys Open + Color and Wood Proofs
updates.update_content:
Greetings Crabbers...
I have opened up the backer surveys, so please log in to your Kickstarter account ASAP and fill out your survey.
We've received both the color proofs and the wood proofs for CRABS! and everything looks pretty good. There were a couple of printing blemishes on the rulebook pages, but those will be fixed during the actual printing. Here are a few photos for you.

Greetings Crabbers...
Just a short update today to share the samples photo of the wood bits from the manufacturer. The X'd out token is a mistake at the factory and will not be included in the games. Otherwise, the colors and shapes look correct to the RFQ and Quotes. The large token is the First Player Token and will have a black screen print of the fisherman. The crab tokens are the player markers that track your progress along the gear track.

Greetings Crabbers...
We've received the Digital Proofs from the printer and if you'd like to look everything over, proof read it, and let us know if you find any typos or errors, you can download the PDF files from this Drive folder: 
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ap3TmY462PEU1BxkUYc_PaCS3flf_iCT

Greetings Crabbers...
Please forgive me for being absent from comments and updates for the last two months. The comments for all of our projects were getting filtered into my junk mail folder and I failed to manually check on things. Now, two months later, i’m here to apologize for my inattention.
Project Progress

Greetings Crabbers!
Yay!  You did it.  Crabs! is funded! You got the extra Vendor Card for the BGG Thumb Drive. And, you squeaked over the $6,000 mark to score the Octopus Gear Card. Excellent!
I'll be emailing the three backers who pledged at the custom art level and we'll zip everything off to the printers as quickly as possible!

campaign.story:
THE TRIAL OF NATURE’S GRACE
Ally with the legendary creatures of Xyleria, harness their abilities, cast powerful spells, visit magical places, and master the elemental realms to become the next Druid of Nature's Grace!
STRATEGY, CREATURES, COMBOS, OH MY!
Legendary Creatures is a deck and resource management game where you cleverly combine your creatures' abilities, magic spells, and powerful amulets in a race through four elemental realms. However watch out: as you maneuver for mastery in one realm your opponents may steal the lead in another. 
You'll have only 9 rounds to prove yourself using a wide range of tactics and strategies to claim the title: Druid of Nature's Grace.
Select your legendary creatures, leverage their abilities, and befriend new ones to evolve your creature party.
Use powerful amulets, cast Druidic spells, and manage your resources to aid your familiars and outmaneuver your opponents.
Explore ancient landmarks to gain renown and unique advantages.
Legendary Creatures is 2-4 players, 30minutes/player, and 13+.
Chris Hamm - designer of Strife - has created an approachable and expanded take on ability, creature, and spell combinations. Lou Catanzaro & Sebastian Koziner bring it to life with incredible creatures, environments and striking graphic design and Eduardo Baraf of Pencil First Games is at the helm of Legendary Creatures to ensure it stays on your shelf and table for years to come.
Kickstarter Exclusive Creatures!
All backers receiving Legendary Creatures get a full set of Medusa and Hydra wild creatures to add to the Vast Expanse.
For meeple size, see the More Information section
                                                                                                  Board Game Closet

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Legendary Creatures is Pencil First Games' sixth Kickstarter. Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet!, The Siblings Trouble, GemPacked Cards, Heroes and Tricks, and Herbaceous all successfully funded and shipped to backers. We strive to run excellent Kickstarters and deliver fantastic products.

Legendary Creatures is well tested and balanced. The graphic design is complete and the card art is final. Box and instructions are near final and we have been working closely with our printer.

There are inherent risks whenever undertaking a project as complex and large as producing and distributing a board game, but I have been making complex projects with countless moving parts and large budgets most of my career. I've gone out of my way to surround myself with experienced board game developers, distributors, and people who have run and launched successful Kickstarters. This team of friends has been exceedingly supportive and I'm sure will help as we hit any upcoming bumps in the road. And there are bumps. Strikes, shortages, shipping delays are all hard to predict.

Most importantly, if something does go wrong, I will keep everyone in the loop as the project moves forward and comes to market. This game will exist because you all will have made it happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Team Awesome,
I hope everyone has been enjoying the beginning of Spring. Now that we are reaching the end of May, I wanted to wrap-up Huge thanks to all of you for making it a reality!

updates.update_userinfo: April Update: Shipped, Key Info, BGG, and Heroes Welcome
updates.update_content: I'm absolutely thrilled to announce that all games are shipped and on their way (if they haven't already arrived). Without a doubt, fulfillment this year has been my most challenging and frustrating, but reading all the kind words and seeing all the pictures of people playing is a healing reminder that all of this work is for the opportunity to send out a little joy to all of you.

Team Awesome, 
I reached out to all of our shipping partners yesterday and I now have more details on Legendary Creatures fulfillment. Looks like there were a few unfortunate snags, but we're still in the KS delivery window.  Details and adjustments below - one of the many reasons I continue to use words like "should" in these notes.
Casa Baraf: The packages I was shipping from my home were dropped off in the mail yesterday. That's great, but this is a minority of the packages being shipped.

Things have been progressing smoothly towards fulfillment, which is being handled across three different sites: , , and . Packages are being organized / prepped and shipping data ingested at all sites.

updates.update_userinfo: February Update: The Shipment Journey Continues...
updates.update_content: Short update this month. The freight shipments of continue along their journey. The US bound shipment has arrived at port and the UK (WW) bound shipment should be arriving in the next few weeks. They'll then reach fulfillment, be packaged up, and shipped along to backers! Assuming no issues or surprises direct fulfillment to backers should kick off mid-March. I expect to have lots of specifics in next month's March update.

updates.update_userinfo: January Update: We've left the factory!
updates.update_content: Happy New Year! This morning I received official word that both the US and WW pallets of have been picked up from Whatz Games in China!
I hope everyone is having a fantastic December. Progress with has been trucking along nicely. As planned, Whatz Games sent me the 1st Print Sample for .
All files have been approved and manufacturing is set to begin by the end of next week at Whatz Games. We are going to be doing a second check on meeples and the insert next week as well.

updates.update_userinfo: October Update: Print Proof/Box Samples and Sunset Over Water
updates.update_content: I hope everyone is gearing up for a fantastic October. is steaming along -
I hope everyone had a great gaming month in August. I was thrilled to meet a number of you at Gen Con 50!

campaign.story:
Trash Pandas is easy to learn, portable, and fun for all ages. In Trash Pandas, players are raucous raccoons, tipping over trash cans for food (and shiny objects). Players push their luck to acquire more trash cards, but must stash them in order for them to count as points at the end of the game.
Final cover
    54 cards
6 tokens
2 sets of token stickers (extra set for both sides or as a spare)
1 custom die
Rules, box, etc.
          Final rules found HERE
    Player aid
    These bonuses will be added to each copy of the game.  So, if you backed for multiple copies, you'll get the bonus item(s) for each  copy.
If we make it to $5,000 - we'll include a custom sticker with each game.  This will likely be an image of the box cover artwork, but we will listen to input from the backers as well.
  If we make it to $8,000 -  we'll include the previous bonus as well as a custom button or magnet.  We haven't yet decided which item it will be, but will listen to backer input to determine which is most preferred.
    Michael Wright - The Unfiltered Gamer
  Eric Buscemi : The Cardboard Hoard (PunchBoardMedia.com)
    Andrew Foster - Beasts of War
   Cassie Ellie
Tantrum House

   We are super stoked to showcase the massive talents of Kwanchai Moriya! 
http://www.kwanchaimoriya.com/
We've been huge fans of Kwanchai's work since we first encountered it in the game Zombie in my Pocket. Kwanchai has a distinct style that is immediately recognizable. When looking for an artist for the game, we made a list of possible artist and decided to dream big. Not only did Kwanchai agree to illustrate the game, he was excited about it and has been amazing to work with.
Kwanchai Moriya is an illustrator and painter. He was born in New York and grew up in the suburbs of Chicago. He completed his education with a degree in History from the University of California and a degree in Illustration from the Art Center College of Design. Kwanchai lives and works in Los Angeles, California with his lovely lady and pet tortoise.
He has a passion for making fun illustrations, and has worked primarily in board games, card games, and children's books. Kwanchai is also an avid painter, working mostly in acrylics with science fiction and fantasy themes. His other hobbies include making wood toys, playing board games, and backpacking.
Kwanchai has illustrated quite a few board games, including: Kodama, Prospectus, Loop Inc., Days of Ire, Capital Lux, and the Catacombs family of games.
    We have been working with LongPack games to manufacture Trash Pandas.  LongPack is known for producing some high quality games; check out their showcase here:  http://www.longpackgames.com/card-board-games-showcase/
  Digital sample
      Even if you can't support financially or if you've already backed on the previous campaign, we'd love to have you join this campaign. Please help us get the word out by sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, Myspace, YouTwitFace, or whatever all the cool kids are using these days.
                                  Thanks for checking out Trash Pandas! This game has been a labor of love that has developed quite a bit over the past few years and we are beyond thrilled to share it with the world.
  Thanks to everyone who has helped us get this far and to everyone who will join us along the way!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've been designing and developing games for a while, but this is our first real attempt to publish a game. 

This project has definitely a growing experience and we are confident that we have the support and resources to make it a success. Trash Pandas is a relatively small game, so the production and delivery should be fairly straight forward.

One of the biggest challenges of producing a game is managing the production costs, shipping, and estimating the time it takes to get the game to the backers. We have been closely involved with several other crowdfunding campaigns (working with publishers as a designer) and learned quite a bit from their success and mistakes. So far, we've backed 94 Kickstarter projects so we really value the platform and the Kickstarter community. Though we are new to this particular arena, we have thoroughly researched these aspects to ensure our goals are attainable.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Well, we are close to 72 hours after the initial email that gave the 48 hour warning so we have no idea what is going on with that. We still haven't heard back since replying on Friday so our guess is that there is no weekend support. Also, this seems to be a manual process so maybe Kickstarter will take one last look before pulling the plug and see that this is not what it was originally assumed to be.  We are trying to work with Kickstarter to salvage the campaign and have updated the main page to reflect our current focus.  Previously, we included a lot of details that we thought were interesting about the history, but ended up distracting from this campaign are not necessarily relevant at this point.  This information is still in the comments and updates and we are happy to answer any questions about the history, status, and further plans.

Greeting team Trash Panda,
TLDR: Kickstarter has informed us that they are canceling the Trash Pandas campaign.  Once canceled, we may not be able to contact you or send updates.  If you would like to keep in contact about getting a copy of the game, please send an email to RedRookGames@gmail.com  
----------------------------------------------------------------------

updates.update_userinfo: Good news, bad news, good news!
updates.update_content:
Hey Team Trash Panda!
We weren't planning for another update so soon but have some recent developments to share.
First, some good news.  We added a new reward tier for the sticker/magnet set that we are including as a stretch reward bonus in each copy.  This means that those who weren't able to get in on the game itself can still get in on the bonus stuff until a second print run happens.  Each set is $5 with free shipping in the US and only $1 for non-US shipping.  If there is any interest in multiple sets, let us know and we can put that together.

And Kickstarter has a whole method set up to deal with that including allowing creators to adjust quantities available throughout the campaign, so obviously that's okay too. The creators have explained thoroughly their process and story, and enough of us found that compelling enough to want to support their efforts. Personally, I think that this type of project is EXACTLY what Kickstarter should be about. While I tend to agree with you regarding huge companies like CMON using Kickstarter as a preorder mechanism, Kickstarter itself seems to be okay with that and getting a cut of the multi-million dollar campaigns.

campaign.story:
Build groves to expand your realm, manage your pool of spirits, and optimize your resource production to become the ruler of Idyllon!
                      Idyllon was the crown jewel of Faerie Queen Nivarra’s kingdom. Once upon a time. Since her passing, this once great land has dissolved into formless void. While all of the Fae kingdom has mourned this tremendous loss, you – the Guardians of the Four Winds – have vowed to restore Idyllon to its former glory.
Groves is a strategy game that combines worker placement with bag building. There are multiple worker types that a guardian can summon to reap the benefits of the land.
Rounds start with players drawing three spirits (workers) from their summoning bag and placing them one at a time.
After drawing their Spirits, players take turns placing those Spirits in available locations. At the start of the game, Spirits can be played on a player's own groves or onto the central Tree of Idyll.
Once a player constructs a portal, that player can also place their Spirits onto another player's groves.
Playing on Groves will earn a player resources and/or dominion points. Any spirit earns the general ability (lower left).  When a paired spirit is played on a matching grove, the player earns the general ability as well as the bonus ability (bottom right).
Playing at the Tree of Idyll allows players to purchase new Groves (crystal costs vary and are paid to the player currently holding the crown token), collect summoning bonuses, and construct portals.
After all players have placed their three spirits, any spirits in the Tree of Idyll are discarded, while the spirits played on groves are placed in the summoning bag of the owner of the realm they are played in (regardless of which player played them there).
The game continues until the Grove deck runs out. Players count Dominion from their groves, Dominion earned from Grove abilities, Dominion earned from completed summoning bonus cards, and any Dominion earned from global bonuses that they collected. The player with the most Dominion wins! 
To win, players must make the most of their realm by adding new Groves to gain Dominion Points and new abilities. They must also optimize their draws by adding new, helpful Spirits while banishing unwanted Spirits to the Tree of Idyll or to their opponents' realms.
Learn more about the gameplay by watching this Learn to Play by Cassie Elle!
                                                                                                *Multiplayer and solo variant both included on Tabletopia!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Letiman Games, LLC has now successfully fulfilled 4 different campaigns, all of which were fulfilled on time! We have forged numerous relationships in the industry that will help insure we stay on track and succeed in fulfillment even if issues arise. 

We have a proven track record that we believe in open and honest communication by posting consistent updates and images of production in process. We also have proven that we deliver great games full of quality components at a reasonable price. We guarantee we will succeed in delivering a high quality game and we will do everything in our power to make sure that happens in our expected timeline.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Groves fulfillment update and our next game is live on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hello friends of the fae!
GROVES FULFILLMENT UPDATE
I hope you have all been well since our last update! First off, I just wanted to again thank you for everything. Groves should be fulfilled in completion at this point. If you either have not received your game or have damaged parts, please reach out to me and let me know so I can remedy the situation.

updates.update_userinfo: Groves is starting to arrive on backers' doorsteps!
updates.update_content:
Hello Friends of the Fae
This is by far the best update to make, games are starting to arrive on backers doorsteps!  We are so excited to announce that all games, both domestic and international, have shipped and are en route. Some backers have even mentioned receiving them already!
If you notice any problems with your games, be sure to email us at contact.letimangames@gmail.com as we want to ensure you receive a fantastic product!

This is the moment you have all been waiting for!  Groves has arrived, has cleared customs, and has been picked up at the port warehouse and is en route to the fulfillment centers! 
The games are expected to arrive to US fulfillment centers tomorrow or Wednesday the latest and shipping should start shortly after that.  This will also include all non-EU international as well. We expect our EU shipment to arrive at the fulfillment center by Tuesday of next week but possibly as early as this Friday. 

I will keep you posted as fulfillment commences but basically you will start receiving notifications of shipping and you should start receiving games in the next week or two!

updates.update_userinfo: A Boat is booked and we are in the final stretch!
updates.update_content:
Hello Friends of the Fae
I hope you all had a fantastic end to 2017 and have started off 2018 well! Everything is moving smoothly here at Letiman Games HQ!  We just wanted to give you an update on Groves and let you know where everything is at this point.

Hello Everyone!

I just wanted to update everyone on where we are and what is going on with production! Mass production is underway, many many games are being printed! The last time I updated you, I sent pictures of the components but the box insert was still being processed. I wanted to share images of the insert with you because it is looking AWESOME! (and for those of you worrying, this version fits the cards snugly but they are increasing the card well size to accommodate sleeves for the mass production final copies).

updates.update_userinfo: Proof Copy is in my hands and it looks SO GOOD!
updates.update_content:
Hello Friend of the Fae! 
   I have some exciting news to share with you! I received the proof copy of the game and it looks AWESOME! It took a little longer than expected with going back and forth with our printer and issues with accessing Dropbox but after a lot of long nights and lengthy email chains, we finally got everything squared away and the printing came out PHENOMENAL. Here are some images for you to drool over! Some of the colors look off from the lighting in my house and the camera phone but they look great in person!

updates.update_userinfo: Monthly Update and Art Prints have shipped to US backers!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone!
It has been about a month since we last spoke but I just wanted to update you guys on what has been happening. Basically we are still waiting on the proof copy. This game has a lot of non-standard pieces (not just cards and boards) so we have been working with the printer to optimize everything and make sure it is being done right. We have been ensuring the insert is just right (with space for card sleeves), the wooden bits are custom cut properly, and that the proper crystal gems are sourced to make sure they are what we envision to reflect the theme of the game. Sorry there is not much more to update on for the process yet but making sure everything is set up and printed right the first time is one of the hardest and most important steps of the process. I will update you as soon as I have the proof copy and will share many many pictures.

updates.update_userinfo: Gadgeteers has shipped out and status update!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone,

I have the last month has treated you well. I just wanted to check in for a one month update to let you know where everything is in our process.
1.) Gadgeteers has shipped out
2.) Art prints are being ordered this weekend
Gadgeteers has shipped out to US based backers

updates.update_userinfo: Progress Update and Backer Surveys Coming Soon!
updates.update_content:
Hey Everybody,
I hope you have all been well since our last update! We are just about one month post-funding and I just wanted to touch base to keep you posted on two things:
1.) Progress
2.) Backer Surveys
Progress

campaign.story:
Pocket Ops is a 2-player game of deduction and area control. As Spymasters, position your Spies and Specialists to outmaneuver your opponent and dominate the battlefield.
Players must stay one step ahead of their opponent on a battleground that is as much in the minds of the Spymasters as on the board. Predict your opponent’s moves to prevent them from gaining ground, and when all hope seems lost, snatch victory away from your opponent with clever use of your Specialist agents.
If you are the first to capture both parts of the Doomsday Device, it’s game over for your opponent.
A quick review of the game board and object will reveal that Pocket Ops is based on the familiar framework of tic-tac-toe — but don't write it off as child's play just yet! The prediction mechanic and Specialist abilities have been proven to offer playtesters both challenge and laughter. Don't believe it? Check out the sample Print n' Play files below:
   ...or check out the Tabletop Simulator mod on Steam!
  Pocket Ops is the first published design of Brandon Beran, with art and graphic design by industry veteran Josh Cappel.
         Pocket Ops is quick to pick up, because you already know how to play; If you've played Tic-Tac-Toe before, you have the fundamentals: place markers in a grid, trying to get three in a row. But wait! The simple but game-changing twist with Pocket Ops is that before you make a move, the other player gets to secretly predict where you are going to go. After your move, if they were right, your move is canceled. In addition, a variety of Specialist tokens that introduce all sorts of sneaky abilities will change the way you place and predict. Pocket Ops takes a classic framework and breathes surprising life into it. For a more detailed look, check out this fantastic overview by Tantrum House, below:
  Arch Gaming Network

~Mark Capell-Helm

                                                              For all backers, we are charging shipping as indicated. For Canadians, this also covers import taxes and customs duties.
Unfortunately, we can't offer the same outside the US and Canada, because it is simply too expensive. However, any EU orders will be "EU Friendly", in that they will not incur VAT or customs fees on delivery.
  We know that international shipping is annoyingly expensive; believe us, we are just as annoyed as you are! However, to help offset the shipping costs a bit, we have created the 4- and 10-copy levels with lower pricing per copy.
     We are very happy to bring this project to you via Kickstarter. Keeping true to our philosophy, we have asked for an amount that will get us halfway to what we need to produce the game. It will take about twice as much money as we are asking to bring Pocket Ops to life, and our part is ready. You showed amazing support for the Guild with Unreal Estate, and we know we can count on your for this current project. 
~Fondly,
Marc Specter, GuildMaster
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project that involves the production and manufacture of a good to be delivered, there is certainly a real chance for hiccups and delays. Many board game projects on Kickstarter have been seriously hampered by art production delays, problems with an overseas factory, missing units and one shipping snafu after another.

We won't lie - stuff happens. Delays can occur. Sometimes you have to go back and forth on color samples six times just to get the color right, and even then the color isn't perfect. But what we do promise is that we will hold ourselves to the same high standards and transparency we expect from other board game publishers and our previous projects, and we will be completely honest and open with each of you every step of the way.

Aside from artwork changes that may come about as a result of stretch goals, this game is finished and ready to go to Bang Wee, the experienced manufacturer of our two previous titles.

We learned a lot from our first Kickstarter campaign, and we feel confident that those lessons will help us make this campaign successful.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Shenanigans are afoot at the North Pole!
updates.update_content:
Good afternoon, Agents! It's been a while. I hope this update finds you safe and healthy in these challenging times.
As fans of small portable games, I wanted to let you know about our latest project. Grand Gamers Guild is proud to announce our 18-card escape room game: The Kringle Caper!
Endangered needs your support!
Good morning Agents! It's been a while, but today I'm going to ask you to look at a new mission profile: Project Shikoku!

Good morning Agents. It's been a while.
I wanted to reach out and let you know that we just launched our next game on Kickstarter: The Artemis Project.

To you that have supported us previously, we go live at 9 tomorrow morning. Feel free to check out the video and the campaign. We hope to see you there: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/burntislandgames/1508813296?ref=433593&token=de981c5c

Today ends the voting for the BGG Most Anticipated Games of 2018 nominations. If you’ve not already given a thumb to our next project Endeavor, please do: https://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/231943/item/5764955#item5764955
If you want to find out more about the progress of the project, visit endeavorgame.com. Thanks!

Hey everyone! Fulfillment began earlier this week, and we're getting comments that Pocket Ops is showing up on your doorsteps. Very exciting! Hopefully you can get your first games in this weekend. Be sure to take pictures for us to post on our Facebook page as well as BoardGameGeek.
And speaking of BGG... Can I ask a favor? Would you go and rate Pocket Ops for us? The more ratings we get, the higher we'll climb. The higher we climb, the more copies we'll sell. And the more we sell, the greater the chance for a reprint and additional content.

Good morning Agents! You might be saying, "That is a very strange name for a Backer update." Well, that is the number of miles I traveled yesterday over 13 hours to take care of Pocket Ops fulfillment for you. If you follow us on Facebook, you might have caught the 3 short videos I posted yesterday in my travels.
This was one of those situations where you wait, and wait, and wait, and then everything happens all at once. Our lovely little game was making its way cross country, when I got the call Monday morning that the games were in fact in Ft. Wayne IN and would be delivered to Impressions the next day (Tue Nov 28). The calendar showed that I did not have any commitments, and so shortly after 8a the next day I got in the car and drove to Ft. Wayne.

Good morning Agents! Good news abounds!
We recently got the notification from the logistics company that Pocket Ops is on our shores. As of the original note 3 days ago, it was waiting for customs clearance and off-loading. Once that is complete, it will be separated from the rest of the container in which it traveled and then begin the journey to Impressions in Ft. Wayne, Indiana.

In the Pocket
Pocket Ops has been an amazing success at Essen! It’s very easy to underestimate a game as simple as this one… even being the publisher, I still do it myself! But then I play the game, and BAM, I realize why I signed it. We’ve gotten so many great reactions when people have that “Oh my gosh!” moment.

Just put together the PnP. Very nicely done- mostly... My only complaint is that the front and backs of the cards don't quit align. I printed each single-sided and glued them together. I did this with the full 8.5x11 sheet then cut the cards out. The images are offset by about 3/16 inch to the side. So when I cut the individual cards, I cut along the back. When you look at the front of the card you can see a strip of the card next to it. Not the worst thing in the world. I will reprint the front and backs then cut around the perimeter then glue and do the final cuts next time. I'm taking this with me on vacation so had to get it done quickly.

@GGG: I was proposing (again) a *card* that, instead of guessing a number, guesses "Specialist" (predicting instead that the opponent will use a Specialist, no matter what space). You had said it might be too powerful, and I was suggesting that to balance it, after using this card, successful or not, the card is given to your opponent for their use. A neat little one card promo.

@GGG: I was rereading some of the comments and an idea came to me. You mentioned interest in making the "Specialist" guess-card a promo... possibly having to limit it to one-time use. How about this... When you play it, successful or not, *it goes to your opponent,* for their future use. This means only a single card addition to the game! And it makes the choice to use it a difficult one.

Just my 2 cents, but I also like the idea of printing only on one side of the discs. When playing you want to keep it a secret of when you are going to use your specialist and if it's printed on both sides your opponent will know when you pick up and are about to play your specialist. The only other option is to keep all the discs hidden some way but just being able to flip them to a blank side so your opponent can't see seems to be the most logical solution.

Regarding the standard meeples - I prefer the silkscreen option, but also can see a desire for only 1-sided printing. Not for when they're laid out in front of me after the specialist selection, but for when played on the board. This way, it's easier to analyze the board at a glance because the only visible symbols are those of the specialists. Having them printed on only one side allows for players to choose which they prefer (visible or printed side up) when playing on the board.

campaign.story:
UPDATE:  Wow - FULLY FUNDED IN UNDER 4 HOURS WITH A STRETCH GOAL ALREADY UNLOCKED! You are all amazing! We'll be posting updates as the day progresses and catching up to all of your questions and comments soon. For now, THANK YOU SO MUCH!
UPDATE: Multilingual support added!
UPDATE: International partner Spieleschmiede campaign funds added to US total for stretch goal unlocks.
5-16-17 / 11pm 
TOTAL: $63,450 (US) + $4,853 (DE) = $68,303 worldwide
 Tesla vs. Edison: Duel is a fun, easy-to-learn, 2-player card game that takes less than 30 minutes to play. Duel distills the epic War of Currents to its essence while still preserving all major areas of play from the original smash hit. 
Choose Your Side. It's AC vs DC - and only one can win! 
Play as Famous Inventors. Select Nikola Tesla, Thomas Edison, or one of six other amazing inventors to run your electric company and compete for control over the nascent electricity industry of the United States. Each inventor plays differently leading to unique experiences every game. 
Recruit Heroes of Engineering, Business, and Popular Culture. Some of the most well-known historical figures from the actual War of Currents join your company and play key roles in your quest for glory. J.P. Morgan, H.G. Wells, Mark Twain, and others bring deeper thematic immersion and a wide range of special abilities. 
Build an Empire. Vie for victory by controlling two of the three available regions: New England, New York, and Out West. 
Claim Electricity Projects. From Boston to Chicago, players extend their influence over each region by completing projects in the important cities of the time. 
Discover New Technologies. Develop the "latest and greatest" technologies, seize pre-eminence from your opponent, and forge new relationships with other companies that assist your bid for victory. 
Play the Stock Market. Joust with your opponent for control of other enterprises. Six minor companies, each with their own preferred technology, are also in the electricity business and located across the three regions. Acquire their stock if you lead in a company’s preferred technology and increase your own regional influence. 
Conduct Nefarious Propaganda. Promote AC or DC to lead public perception for added bonuses. Lobby against your opponent’s technology to hamper their regional control. Propaganda is central to any winning strategy! 
All in Less Time Than Lunch! While Tesla vs. Edison: Duel is a recognizable adaptation of our best-selling core game Tesla vs. Edison, the experience is very different and entirely unique. With lightweight rules, minimal table space, and play time under 30 minutes, Duel is a great game-over-lunch experience for casuals with enough strategic depth for hobby gamers too! 
Come play the War of Currents heads-up and enjoy our latest addition to the world of Tesla vs. Edison!
                   Tesla vs. Edison: Duel pits two players head-to-head in a fast and fun area control game that packs a ton of electrifying goodness into a small package. Complete rules are available, and we’ve also highlighted some key aspects of play here.
It all start with your Inventor.  Pick Tesla, Edison, or one of six other geniuses and prepare for the Duel. Each Inventor also has a different "instant win" condition so be sure to keep a close eye on your opponent!
Your Assistants can claim projects, acquire stocks, influence playable power types in regions, conduct propaganda on the PR track, and advance technologies to help you expand your empire. Duel takes place over three phases. At the start of each phase, draft Assistants to work for your company. Alternate with your opponent and activate one Assistant each per turn by taking the two actions shown on each Assistant’s card until the phase is finished.  Play is smooth and speedy with almost no downtime.
Players battle for control of three regions. Regions award different bonuses and are scored at the end of each phase based on player influence. 
Claim a Project from the market and put it on your side of the board, contributing points to your control of that region. 
While you advocate for your preferred power, AC or DC, you also can develop technology of the time to lead in Transformers, Light Bulbs, or Electric Meters. Taking the card for one of these technologies endears you to smaller power companies that can help your bid for victory.
The stock market still plays a key role in Duel. Your company gives you influence in its home region. If you lead in a minor company’s preferred technology, you can also acquire their shares to increase your influence in the region where they do business. The more shares you hold, the more influence you wield. You can also sell stock shares for free actions!
Don’t forget the battle for public perception and PR. Place No AC or No DC tokens on a region to entirely block your opponent’s technology there - at least until they counter!  You can also increase the popularity of your chosen power technology on the PR track. Along with giving you more control over the No AC and No DC tokens, advancing here yields bonus actions and also serves as a tiebreaker for region control, sometimes literally winning you the game!
After three rounds of play, whichever player controls two or more of the game's three regions wins. But don't forget each Inventor's unique instant win condition - if they achieve this goal during the game then they win immediately!
         Tesla vs Edison: Duel will be manufactured in China. Copies will then be sent to our fulfillment partner depots in various regions around the world for ultimate distribution to backers. This saves you on shipping and extra taxes.
We're offering deeply discounted shipping to our backers everywhere. We recognize that even with these discounts, shipping to many parts of the world is just plain expensive, but we're doing what we can to make it easier.
Given our strategy of shipping to regional fulfillment depots, various countries will receive their copies at different times. Historically, backers in Asia and the Pacific receive their copies soonest since they are nearest to our manufacturer, then the U.S. and western Europe are relatively close together, and finally backers in the rest of the world receive theirs. We anticipate that all backers will receive their copies by October 2017, but most of you will receive your copies sooner. We'll keep you posted with more details via regular updates as we move forward into production and fulfillment.
Finally, we also hope to offer Gen Con pickup for backers as we have in the past for other Kickstarter campaigns. The summer con season is very important for us. There's a chance we land the ocean container here in time for the show, but if not, we're planning on air shipping a limited quantity to Indianapolis for backer pickup and sales. We realize that this may occur before some backers, particularly those in more remote locales, have received their games and we're offering Gen Con pickup to give people more fulfillment options as a result. We'll provide more details about this via updates closer to Gen Con. We hope you understand and still choose to support our project!
    Artana is committed to supporting our retail partners. We offer wholesale pricing to verified stores and other gaming establishments. We treat you like other backers, but you will receive your rewards ahead of other normal distributions channels. If you are a verifiable retailer, please contact us through Kickstarter or send an email to hello@artana.com for more information about how to pledge at this level.
(Designer) Dirk Knemeyer is the creative director of Artana. This is his tenth published game, including award-winners Tesla vs. Edison, Tomorrow, and The New Science. Dirk is also a host of The Game Design Round Table podcast, a show that talks to both digital and tabletop game designers about the theory and practice of game design. Outside of gaming, Dirk is a social futurist, studying culture and technology in order to propose better systems of existence. He lives in the Boston, Massachusetts area with his wife and two of his children.
(Lead Developer) J.R. Honeycutt is a full-time developer at Artana. In addition to Tesla vs. Edison: Duel and other projects at the studio, he was the lead developer for SeaFall. JR is the co-designer of Unpub: The Published Card Game, Fantasy Fantasy Baseball, and other games. JR plays games and helps people through DFW Nerd Night, a community organization that has helped raise more than $75,000 for charities. He lives in Fort Worth, TX with his wife, Amy, and their two cats.
(Art Director) Heiko Günther grew up on a mostly forgotten mesa in the depths of South America. He was raised by direct descendants of the Incan Empire and trained in the ancient art of Shinobi warfare. At the age of 8, he was given into the care of a globetrotting science fiction writer and acquired degrees in literature, science, and arts. From the age of 14 until 17, he worked on fishing trawler in the far eastern seas, perfecting his knowledge of forgotten languages and Polynesian mysticism. Since then, he lives in Saarbrücken, Germany, mostly, does graphic design and likes board games.
  Founded in 2015, Artana produces quality games and accessories to customers around the world. This is our fifth Kickstarter, also including Einstein,  Tesla vs. Edison and the Powering Up! Expansion, Corrupted Kingdoms, and The Best Damn Gaming Coins Ever. The Artana team includes game industry veterans in all aspects of game design, development, art, and business. We seek to provide fresh themes, innovative mechanics, engaging play, beautiful components, and thought-provoking experiences.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with all Kickstarter projects, there are risks outside our control that could slow down delivery of the project - shipping or customs delays, acts of God, unexpected power outages, etc. However, our team at Artana has finalized almost all of the art, components, and design of Tesla vs. Edison: Duel. We've tested it, retested it, given it love, and are ready to send the game to print as soon as the campaign is over. Artana has successfully delivered three Kickstarter campaigns with a fourth on the way. We know how to quickly and accurately fulfill pledges for our backers. We believe that the process of delivering Tesla vs. Edison: Duel! will be smooth and seamless, and should result in your having a light, fun, and strategic 1-2 player version of a much-loved game and expansion in your hands within our shipping timeframe.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Lovelace & Babbage NOW LIVE - New Artana Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Hi everyone!
You’re getting this update since you previously backed Tesla vs. Edison: Duel and we have a fabulous new history and science game we think you'll love that just launched on Kickstarter – Lovelace & Babbage by Scott Almes of Tiny Epic fame! The campaign funded in under an hour and has over 1,300 backers with a bunch of stretch goals already unlocked so come check it out and join the fun!

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment Completing + Our Newest Game Now On Kickstarter - Speakeasy Blues!
updates.update_content: Hi everyone!  Fulfillment for Duel is largely complete and is winding down.  If you're in the US, Canada, or the EU and haven't received your game by Monday, please PM us so we can address your issue.  APAC is largely complete though the Chinese holiday slowed things down a bit so please give those games about one more week and then message us if you haven't received yours.  For everyone else, the games are making their way to you and if they haven't arrived already they should be there in the next couple of weeks.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update Plus A New Review
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone - nothing but great news here from Artana today!  So, without further ado...
Games Are Shipping To Depots!

updates.update_userinfo: Production Update and Gen Con Pickups
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone!  Hope you are enjoying a fantastic summer.  We have all good news to report in this latest update!
Gen Con Pick Up
As expected, it's on!  For those of you who indicated in the pledge manager that you wanted Gen Con pick up of Duel, we're delighted to report that you'll be able to get your rewards at the show next week.  You should have already received an email to confirm your pick up.  If you haven't seen it yet, please check your spam folder or PM us for assistance and we'll be happy to help.  See you at booth 1159 next week!

In the midst of getting the survey out to everyone just now, we didn't enable one of the most important questions - whether you want Gen Con pickup or not!  We've now added the question.  For those of you that completed your surveys before this update, please go back and check that box yes or no so we can get a sense for how many we may need to ship.  Most people haven't yet so it should not be an issue.  If you have any problems with things, just PM us and we'll address things for you.

updates.update_userinfo: Official Campaign Survey Now Available + Gen Con Pickup
updates.update_content:
Hi all! 
 We hope that everyone (at least in the Northern Hemisphere) is enjoying the summer months. We've got some great news in this update so please read carefully!
First, mass production of Tesla vs. Edison: Duel is well under way and ahead of schedule. Based on this and as with many of our prior campaigns, Disclaimer: if there's some crazy unexpected mishap late in production that could change things, but we think the likelihood of this is low. We'll officially confirm in a later update, but tentatively and barring the unexpected, it's on for Gen Con!

updates.update_userinfo: Production Begins, Some Art, and Other News
updates.update_content:
Greetings, dear backers! We have a bunch of Tesla goodness for you in this latest update.
Production Is Starting
First, we're thrilled to report that Duel is officially entering production! We've been busy the past few weeks obtaining translations for the multilingual components, tweaking art, finalizing balance, and generally reviewing everything one last time. We're finally satisfied and it's time to get this show on the road. All files have been uploaded and approved by Panda!

A short but meaningful update today...
They did it!!!

updates.update_userinfo: A Huge Thanks and Where We Go From Here
updates.update_content: First, thank you all for bringing Tesla vs. Edison: Duel to life!  We're coming down from Duel's frenetic finish and sending out this much deserved update to all of you to acknowledge your role in making this project possible.  We've run a lot of Kickstarter campaigns over the years, but every time we feel the same deep emotion at the end - gratitude. We wouldn't be here without you, our fans, and we're incredibly grateful for your faith in us and support which makes us able to create and share our games with everyone.  You all are the best!

Lol, I think I got it now. And I think you're right in assuming that the PR track won't break that tie. As you note, it's not explicitly stated in the rulebook, but it is implicitly stated in the sense that the check and tie-break is done at the whole personal goal level rather than the constituents pieces of the personal goal.

I think you're still not following what I'm asking about - I am NOT asking about both players meeting personal goals. I was playing Tesla, whose Personal Goal is controlling all three technologies AND having the most cities in all three regions. At the end of the game, I had all 3 tech chips and the most cities in 2 of the 3 regions, while in the third region we had an equal number of cities. However, I was ahead on the propaganda track. My question was whether my being ahead on the propaganda track breaks the tie on number of cities in that third region in my favor. If it does, then I met the requirements for the Personal Goal (my opponent was nowhere close to meeting hers), so I won. If not, then we would proceed to final scoring, in which case she had the most points in at least 2 of the regions and won.
I get your question! If both players meet it, then you're correct, there is no tie breaking. If two players both meet their personal goals in any phase then play continues as if neither met it.
I also thought of the comparison between this and 7 Wonders Duel (which I also love). So far, this game seems far more cutthroat and interactive (which is a good thing!).
In fact.. I find it quicker than 7 Wonders Duel with just as many meaningful actions and variations packed in.
I agree, it's tons of fun. Wasn't sure I'd find another game as good as 7 Wonders Duel, but I've found it. And it's not just "another 7 Wonders Duel", it's a different game entirely. Brilliant!

@Chris, if at the end of the third round you're the only one to meet your personal goal, then you win and you don't proceed to final scoring. Addressed in the Personal Goals section of the rules and alluded to in the Final Scoring section of the rules.

campaign.story:
Bridges to Nowhere is a fun, strategic, card drafting micro-game where players build unique bridge designs!  This dynamic game challenges players to keep their wits about them at every draw of the card. Players gain points for their bridge based on construction, height, aesthetics, and completing contract objectives. The player with the highest scoring bridge wins!
What will you build today?
      Help us to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, and Kicktraq to unlock a new mat design! 
First, take turns drafting bridge cards and building your bridge! Pick any card you want, but be aware your opponent will get to pick next. Look for high-point cards and those with excellent synergies like matching bridge types and symbols. Bridge cards can be built onto to your pillar cards so long as they match the bridge type.
Each round, draft new bridge cards and add them to your bridge! Try to draft cards which fit your bridge or cards you know your opponent needs! When building, you can add more pillars to give your bridge great diversity and height for scoring bonuses.
In the final round, finish your bridge by completing all the segments! Draft your last cards and build what you can to finish your bridges, then attach your last pillars to complete each bridge segment. Only completed segments can score.
Determine the winner! Score points printed on each bridge card, multiplying them by their level (x2 for second level, and so on). Award bonus points for each set of adjacent matching symbols. Finally, award points if you met the Contract requirements!
Time for a new match! The player with the highest scoring bridge keeps the Contract card as a victory token. Set up a new game with the loser deciding which player goes first, then play again. The first player to win two Contract cards wins the game!
The Challenge
Bridge parts can only be attached in certain ways and how you navigate these restrictions while striving to fulfill the Contract’s building requirements ultimately determines how well your bridge scores.
For the current rules, click here, or watch our How to Play video below.
                                                                                                                                                         The following is a breakdown of the components of the base game, deluxe game, and the promos.  They also include any unlocked or forth coming stretch goals.
                                                                                                                               You can be a part of bringing Bridges to Nowhere to life by making a pledge to this Kickstarter!
Pledge $12 or more and we will send you one copy of Bridges to Nowhere! This pledge also entitles you to:
any unlocked stretch goals for the base game
one of our limited promo packs
the high quality Print and Play
Pledge $22 or more and get one copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition! You’ll also get:
any unlocked Deluxe stretch goals
TWO of our limited promo packs
the high quality Print and Play
Pledge $30 or more and get one copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition AND one copy of Bridges to Nowhere! You’ll also get:
any unlocked stretch goals
THREE limited promo packs
the high quality Print and Play  
Pledge $35 or more and we’ll send you one copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition including
any unlocked Deluxe stretch goals
two of our limited promo packs
the high quality Print and Play
and our beautiful 14" x 24" game mat to play the game on! This sturdy fabric mat with rubber backing is perfect for protecting your cards, enhancing the look of the game, or just for collecting!
Pledge $100 or more (US and CAN only) and we’ll send you one copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition and 
our beautiful game mat
all unlocked Deluxe stretch goals
the high quality Print and Play
two limited promo packs
and an 11"x14" canvas wrapped print of our game cover artwork to hang wherever you love to see beautiful art. Add $20 to your pledge and we’ll increase the canvas print to 16"x20"!
Pledge $5 or more and receive a high quality version of the Deluxe Edition Print and Play. If you are in an area we don't ship to, please see our note to you in the Shipping section near the end of the page.
Pledge $50 or more (US and CAN only) and receive 
THREE copies of Bridges to Nowhere
THREE copies of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition
NINE limited promo packs for you or your customers
all unlocked stretch goals
You must have a valid retail license. Additional game copies are available upon request and can be handled after the campaign is over.
     After we reach our funding goal, we would love to add content, upgrades, and promos to Bridges to Nowhere. Each stretch goal has a funding level which unlocks specific upgrades outlined below.
                                                                                                                     Other Great Reviews!
Bearded Meeple (video review)
Unfiltered Gamer (video review)
GJJ Games (written review)
What's Eric Playing? (written review)
We want to thank each reviewer for their time and efforts in showcasing our game on their websites and feeds! We hope to have many more to send you!
    Bridges to Nowhere features multiple ways to play the game! 
 This is a two player dueling card game where players compete to be the first to win two contracts. This mode features the greatest strategic depth as players must decide with each draft if they will focus on making the best bridge possible or prevent large scoring plays by their opponent. 
The solo game uses the same components as the dueling game and requires the player win two contracts within three matches. Instead of scoring against an opponent, the player scores against an escalating point requirement predetermined by their skill level. The solo game captures the strategic challenge of the two player game while remaining a streamlined and fun solitary experience.
3 to 4 players compete with one another to be the first to win two contracts. It features a unique drafting method to keep options tight which keeps the game fast while maintaining maximum strategic depth. This mode is great for players of any skill level!
Bridges to Nowhere in Action!
    We offer several add-ons that can be purchased in addition to your pledge.
Bridges to Nowhere Game Mat  (14" x 24" x 1/16") - Add $13 to your pledge (+$3 shipping outside the US/CAN) to receive our beautiful, high quality fabric game mat with rubber backing. It's large enough to support your best bridge designs. (limit 4 total mats with any pledge)
One additional copy of Bridges to Nowhere base game - Add $10 to your pledge to receive one additional copy of Bridges to Nowhere base game. (limit 1)  
One additional copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition - Add $20 to your pledge to receive one additional copy of Bridges to Nowhere Deluxe Edition. (limit 1)  
Additional retail copies (US and CAN only) - If a retail owner would like to purchase additional copies of either version of the game, please pledge at the $50 retail level and contact us directly for rates.
We are offering free shipping to backers in the United States and Canada. This free shipping extends to everything offered with the specific pledge plus any add-ons purchased with the product.
We offer EU friendly shipping for $8 and $10 shipping for countries outside the US/CAN/EU for the base game, Deluxe Edition, and the Deluxe Combo. +$3 shipping for every game mat included for outside of the US/CAN.  We are shipping the product through a UK fulfillment company which will facilitate delivery and reduce external costs.
Below is our expected timeline for production of the game including the expected delivery dates.
To our supporters outside the US, Canada, and the EU  
We are grateful for your patience with us as we explored options to be able to ship the game world-wide. We are pleased to offer you the ability to purchase the base game, Deluxe game, Deluxe Combo, and now Deluxe Plus. We sincerely hope you enjoy our game.
Doomsday Robots Game Company is a board game design and publishing company based out of Dallas, Texas. The company was founded by John Olson in 2013 and includes co-designers, Brad Shankle and Josh Geimer.
Our Vision - We see games as art and creativity as the cornerstone of great design. Our passion is to create fun, high-quality, innovative board games that harmonize mechanics, theme, and presentation into a beautiful tabletop experience!  
We believe we've accomplished this goal with Bridges to Nowhere and hope you will help this project to become the first of many more great tabletop games!
The Doomsday Robots Team
If you'd like to know more about us or subscribe to our mailing list, please go to our website and follow us on Facebook. 
We couldn't have done this alone.  Special thanks to:
Marc Hampson (www.littlebrothersns.com) - Artist and Animator
Marco Cervone - Videographer
Nick Haley - Narrator
The following people and entities have helped us get Bridges to Nowhere to Kickstarter and they deserve special mention. We are grateful for their help and hope they will continue to serve as amazing resources for others.
Dallas Designer Group
   Daniel Zayas
   Jamey Stegmaier
   James Mathe
   James Hudson
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Being the first Kickstarter project for Doomsday Robots, there is much we are learning as we go. While we have a pretty good handle on some elements, like our art, rules, and play-testing, we are still learning how to optimize both manufacturing and fulfillment and expect that we will experience challenges along the way. This is one of the primary reasons we were slow to offer shipping world-wide, to reduce the risks to deliver our product as expected.

We also recognize that we must also provide good customer service and as such are offering a money back guarantee for our product. If you don't like the game or if it arrives damaged, please contact us to coordinate its return and we will refund your money.

While we bring to the table strong planning and financial skills due to our day jobs, there are likely still surprises we are in for, so we are prepared to front additional capital needed to cover any of these unexpected financial issues that may arise.

While we recognize our weaknesses, we must also recognize one of our greatest strengths - we have a solid, amazing game that has been rigorously tested, and we are confident you will enjoy it thoroughly.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Because of your belief in us and our product, Bridges to Nowhere, Doomsday Robots Game Company is a real thing. Being a new company and first time creator we realize you took a chance on us and frankly, we made some mistakes along the way, but you’ve been incredibly supportive of us and for that we are very grateful. We hope you’ll continue to follow us on this journey as we grow as a publisher. We appreciate the feedback we’ve received on how we can be better and will continue to welcome it.

We got a notification today from Spiral Galaxy Games that the freight shipment from China is expected to arrive on Friday at the port in London.  They need the final address list from us.
If you live outside the US, NOW is the time to finalize your shipping address.  I will close address modifications at 4:00 am GMT Wednesday.
I will then send that list to our fulfillment partner for shipping.

There has been a little bit of confusion as to what products are what, so we just want to add a visual to show each product. There has been changes to how things are packaged and designed since we created the Kickstarter, so here is an updated image.

This post is going to focus most on the Deluxe version of the game.  Here are the components you should expect to see in your game.  
Deluxe Components
The first picture is the Deluxe Game without promos.
We are happy to report that we are starting the ship to US backers! The process takes a bit of work and time on our part but starting tomorrow, orders will hit the post office.

I apologize for being late on this update.  The news I expected to share this past weekend was not finalized until today.  But the news is awesome!
For our USA Backers
The product is in the US, has passed customs and in transit to us in Dallas, Texas.  It will arrive on Jun 19th and we will begin shipping orders the same week!
For our International Backers (non-US)

updates.update_userinfo: People in Texas, come get your game!
updates.update_content:
We are nearly at the time to begin shipping our games to our US backers.  The freight shipment is estimated to reach the US in the next two weeks.  Assuming no additional customs delays, the product will make its way directly to us in Dallas, TX.  Once we have it, we will begin shipping orders to our US backers.
As those in the EU know, we changed fulfillment companies.  Considering the problems with our previous company, we had to find someone more reliable, so we switched to  Spiral Galaxy Games (SGG), but the transition has been slow - more forms to fill out and more customs headaches.  We do not have an ETA yet for when the freight will arrive at the port in the UK, so we still aren't certain how long before SGG will ship the product to backers.  I can assure you the shipment will remain EU friendly.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 2nd attempt at this campaign. We learned a lot of things since launching the first time and it has helped us make this project better for both us and you, our backers. We will continue to be as transparent as possible as we want to build trust with our backers. Everyone understands that there always risks involved with Kickstarter campaigns but we will do our best to minimize those risks.

The risks we face are mostly in the manufacturing and fulfillment process as all the art and rulebook are done in house by our team. The artwork is about 85% complete with just some final adjustments to be made. The rulebook is also close to being finished with just some fine tuning of wording and updating the artwork as it is completed.

We have our manufacturer lined up and have talked to fulfillment centres to make sure everything will run as smoothly as possible. All our files will be ready for manufacturing as soon as the Kickstarter is successful. This way we can get started on getting complete samples made and start the manufacturing process as soon as possible.

We've done our best to provide our backers with a reasonable Kickstarter discount for both the game itself and the shipping costs. We hope you'll join in helping us bring this project to life and enjoy playing it as much as we enjoyed designing it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
